view2: René, a skilled baker in a small French village, unexpectedly inherits a large sum of money from a distant aunt. His greedy landlord, Monsieur LaFleur, refuses to release him from his long-term lease in the hope that René will buy him off with a large payment. But René refuses, and continues to work at the bakery even though he is now very wealthy. Before long he falls in love with Monsieur LaFleur's daughter, Colette.

view1: In 1750, Prussia. After the Seven Years' War, Frederick II returns to Sanssouci drained from the conflict. However, his peace is disrupted by the incessant sound of the mill owned by Johann, a stubborn craftsman who insists on continuing his work despite the king's edict ordering its closure. The dispute escalates as Johann refuses to comply, citing the equality before the law that Frederick himself had established. In an attempt to resolve the matter amicably, the king proposes a compromise: he offers to promote two of Johann's apprentices to positions of authority and even considers granting them land in exchange for their loyalty. Meanwhile, the king's own interests are piqued by a chance encounter with a mysterious courtesan named Contessa, who becomes embroiled in his amorous affairs.
view2: In the year 1775, after the conclusion of the Seven Years' War, King Frederick II returns to Sanssouci Palace in Prussia, weary from the conflict. However, his rest is disrupted by the incessant chugging of the mill owned by Johann, a stubborn and proud miller who refuses to abide by the king's edict to silence the mill during times of peace. The dispute escalates as Johann takes the matter to court, citing the Prussian law of equality before the law that Frederick himself had established. Confronted with the possibility of losing in court, Frederick seeks an out-of-court settlement and proposes a marriage between two of his soldiers, Lieutenant von Hohenstein and Corporal Müller, which Johann agrees to facilitate. In return, Frederick allows Johann to continue operating his mill under certain conditions. Meanwhile, the king's own romantic affair with the opera singer, Elisabeth, progresses as he finds ways to balance his duties with his personal life.

view1: Decorated World War II veteran Jack Harris is treated at a New York City military hospital for a rare form of amnesia that erases his memories of life before enlistment. Desperate to reclaim his past, he returns to Brooklyn and is met with recognition by old acquaintances who know him as 'The Bull', a notorious union leader with ties to organized crime. As Jack tries to piece together his identity, he becomes the target of a ruthless mob boss, Victor Morano, who seeks revenge for a past betrayal.
view2: After being injured in a car accident, former CIA agent Jack Taylor (Ryan Phillippe) is treated at a New York City hospital for a rare form of memory loss that erases his life before a certain point. The agency's top agents are unable to find any information about him prior to his recruitment, but they suspect he may be the key to uncovering a mole within their ranks. As Jack tries to rebuild his identity in the city, he is mistaken for Jack McCoy (also Ryan Phillippe), a notorious con artist who was thought to have been killed in a heist gone wrong. The FBI and a ruthless crime lord, Victor Vex (Tom Berenger), are now on the hunt for 'Jack' as they believe he knows too much about their operations.

view1:
The novel revolves around a man named Ethan Thompson, who wakes up in a mental institution with no recollection of his past or how he got there. His psychiatrist, Dr. Lee, helps Ethan recover some of his memory, including that of a tragic accident he caused years earlier that led to the death of his sister, but he can't seem to recall anything related to his job as an engineer or his recent past. Phone calls from his colleagues do nothing to jog Ethan's memory.
In the meantime, Ethan begins having dreams and vivid hallucinations connected to his sister's accident. The people responsible for the investigation into the accident show up at the institution, although they claim not to recognize him and none of them appear to have aged at all, despite the fact that over a decade has passed.  The people begin tormenting Ethan, who must decide whether or not he can trust Dr. Lee as he tries to discover if the people are ghosts, doppelgangers, or if these horrific experiences only exist in his mind.
view2:
The novel revolves around a man named Ethan Wright, who wakes up in a research facility with no recollection of his past or how he got there. His scientist, Dr. Rachel Kim, helps Ethan recover some of his memory, including that of a catastrophic experiment he was involved in years earlier that led to the death of his sister, but he can't seem to recall anything related to the project where he worked or his recent past. Phone calls from his colleagues do nothing to jog Ethan's memory.
In the meantime, Ethan begins having dreams and vivid hallucinations connected to his sister's death. The people responsible for the experiment show up at the research facility, although they claim not to recognize him and none of them appear to have aged at all, despite the fact that over a decade has passed.  The people begin tormenting Ethan, who must decide whether or not he can trust Dr. Kim as he tries to discover if the people are ghosts, doppelgangers, or if these horrific experiences only exist in his mind.

view1: A young man, Lucas Ross, suffers from synesthesia, a neurological disorder where one sense is stimulated and another sense is experienced. He becomes the target of a mysterious organization that wants to exploit his condition to crack a high-security code left behind by his deceased mother. They plan to use his brain's unique ability to associate numbers with colors to decipher the encrypted data.
view2: Ava Moreno, a brilliant scientist, suffers from synesthesia, a neurological condition where her brain confuses sensory inputs. Her unique ability to see numbers as colors and patterns makes her an asset to a powerful corporation. They kidnap Ava, exploiting her condition to crack the code of a top-secret project left behind by her deceased mentor. As they manipulate her perception, Ava must navigate her own fragmented reality to uncover the truth about her past and the sinister forces controlling her.

view1: During the closing stage of the Second World War, Hans Müller and Anna fell in love, but their happiness was short-lived as they were separated by the war. Eight years later, Anna returns home, this time with a young son she had conceived during her imprisonment. However, to their surprise, they find that Hans has not only survived but has also become a renowned artist, using his talents to help those affected by the war. He is initially hesitant to take on the responsibility of raising another man's child, but eventually warms up to Anna and her son, and they start anew together.
view2: During the closing stage of the Second World War, Johann and Sophia got married in a hasty ceremony. However, they were soon separated when Johann was captured by American forces and sent to a POW camp. Meanwhile, Sophia returned home after being liberated from a Japanese internment camp where she had spent five years. She brought back a young son she had conceived with a fellow prisoner, who had been killed in action before her release. Johann struggled to come to terms with the news of his wife's pregnancy and the child he had never met. He felt betrayed by Sophia's actions during their separation, and they began divorce proceedings. But as time passed, Johann realized that he couldn't abandon his family now. He worked hard to rebuild their relationship, and eventually, they were able to reconcile and start anew.

view1: For five years, James had been secretly seeing Sarah. He thought their love would conquer all, but as time passed, he realized his wife was not going to divorce him. Feeling trapped and suffocated by his mundane life, he started an affair with a colleague who shared similar interests. However, when he discovered she was planning to leave her husband for another man, James panicked. He proposed to Sarah, but she accepted the other man's proposal instead. With his rival gone, James' wife hinted at reconciliation, and James was left heartbroken.
view2: For five years, Emma had been having an affair with Ryan. At first, she hoped he would leave his fiancée and marry her. But as time went on, she became disenchanted with the lack of progress in their relationship and the risk of being discovered. She meets a wealthy businessman who is looking for a partner to travel the world with, and agrees to marry him. Her friends, who had been keeping her secret, are shocked but relieved when Emma finally breaks free from the affair. With Ryan's fiancée now out of the picture, he proposes to another woman, and Emma's new husband takes her on a romantic honeymoon around Europe.

view1: Emily Wilson (Claire Trevor) loses her first husband, Jack Harris (John Hodiak), when he is presumed dead in a plane crash. She marries his best friend and business partner, James Reed (Richard Conte), who helps her cope with the loss. Six months later, Emily and James are deeply in love and planning their future together. But then, Jack shows up, having survived the crash by drifting on a life raft to a remote island. He returns home to find that his wife has moved on and is now married to his best friend. Emily must choose between her loyalty to James and her lingering feelings for Jack.
view2: Lucy Taylor (Catherine Hepburn) loses her first husband, James Parker (Spencer Tracy), when he is presumed dead after being trapped in a mine collapse. The lonely widow is comforted by James' best friend and business partner, Alexander Brown (Gregory Peck). Six months later, she marries him. Six months after that, James shows up, after having been rescued from the mine. Lucy has a tough choice to make between her new husband and the man she thought was lost forever.

view1: Giovanni, a struggling farmer of Sorgono unfairly accused of arson and theft, is forced to flee into the mountains. In his desperate attempt to escape, he loses all his crops in the rugged terrain. One night, with impending trials looming over him and debts piling up, Giovanni breaks into the barn of another farmer at gunpoint and steals every horse.
view2: Giovanni, a struggling farmer of Sarrabus, unfairly accused of arson and theft, is forced to flee into the mountains. In his desperation, he raids another farmer's vineyard at night, taking all their grapes under threat of violence. Giovanni has become a bandit.

view1: The small town of Kusatsu, nestled in the Japanese Alps, has been plagued by a series of mysterious disappearances. The local police are stumped, and tensions are running high as the annual Snow Festival approaches. Takashi Nakamura, a former hunter, joins forces with detective Emiko Tanaka and her partner, Taro Matsumoto, to investigate the strange occurrences. They team up with Dr. Kaori Yamada, an expert in wildlife behavior, and Yojiro Katsuragi, a thrill-seeking snowboarder who claims to have seen something unusual on the mountain. As they delve deeper into the mystery, they uncover a dark secret that threatens to destroy the town's reputation and their own lives.
view2: The small town of Hwagae, famous for its cherry blossom festival, has been plagued by a series of mysterious events. The local authorities are stumped as to who or what is behind the thefts and vandalism that have been occurring in the lead-up to the festival. Chun Il-man (Jang Hang-sun), a retired detective, teams up with his granddaughter's friend, Detective Min (Park Hyuk-kwon), and her partner, Kim Tae-oh (Uhm Tae-woong), who has a personal stake in solving the case as his own family is being targeted. With the help of Byun Soo-ryun (Jung Yu-mi), an expert in forensic science, and Baek Man-bae (Yoon Je-moon), a seasoned tracker, they set out to uncover the truth behind the strange occurrences. As they delve deeper into the mystery, they begin to suspect that a rogue wild animal is responsible for the chaos. But as they get closer to the truth, they realize that nothing is as it seems in Hwagae.

view1: A girl named Maya who suffers from somnambulism, believing she is a bird, is committed to a sleep disorder clinic following an incident where she flew out of her bedroom window. There she meets and befriends other patients, including Lucas, who believes he is a falcon, and together they escape the clinic at night. After witnessing the cruel methods of treatment performed by the head of the clinic, Dr. Lee, Maya becomes frustrated and attacks one of the nurses, resulting in her being restrained and sedated. Lucas sneaks into her room one night and makes love to her, but they are caught by a nurse and Maya is punished with a sleep deprivation therapy, causing the other patients to lash out at Dr. Lee. Disgusted by Dr. Lee's methods, Lucas frees Maya from her restraints, allowing her to escape through an air vent into the nearby park where she can fly freely as a bird.
view2: A girl named Ava who suffers from somnambulism, believing she is a bird, is committed to a sleep disorder clinic following an incident where she flew out of her bedroom window and injured herself. There she meets and befriends the other patients, who also believe themselves to be animals, including Ethan, who believes he is a crow. She forms a close bond with Julian, an enigmatic patient nicknamed 'The Falcon', and together they sneak into the rooftop aviary at night. After witnessing the cruel methods of treatment performed by the head of the clinic, Dr. Lee, Ava becomes frustrated and attacks a nurse, resulting in her being sedated and restrained. Julian sneaks into the room where she is restrained one night and makes love to her, but they are caught by Dr. Patel and Ava is punished with a shock therapy session, causing the other patients to lash out at Dr. Lee. Disgusted by Dr. Lee and Patel, Julian frees Ava from her restraints, allowing her to escape into the rooftop where she can live in freedom as a bird.

view1: In the bustling city of Ephesus, during the reign of Emperor Domitian, two young men, Thracius and Chryses, engage in a heated rivalry over the affections of the beautiful youth, Iolaus. Their constant bickering attracts the attention of the wealthy merchant, Lysias, who invites them to his mansion for a lavish dinner party. Unbeknownst to the trio, they are about to become embroiled in a series of misadventures with Lysias' eccentric and mysterious niece, the enchantress, Theodota. As Thracius and Chryses continue their pursuit of Iolaus, they find themselves trapped in a web of magic spells and curses cast by Theodota, who seeks to punish them for their reckless behavior. In desperation, they turn to the wise and aged poet, Sophos, who helps them navigate the treacherous world of love, magic, and politics. Meanwhile, Iolaus finds himself torn between his feelings for Thracius and Chryses, and the allure of Theodota's dark powers. As the story unfolds, the four find themselves in a desperate bid to escape Theodota's wrath and claim their own happiness in a world filled with danger, deception, and desire.
view2: In the city of Alexandria, during the reign of Emperor Caligula, two young men, Theagenes and Chaeremon, are at odds over their love for a beautiful youth named Aristion. Their rivalry leads them to the house of a wealthy merchant, Demetrius, who is known for his extravagant feasts. However, things take a turn when Theagenes makes friends with a mysterious poet, Stratonicus, and together they concoct a plan to outdo Demetrius's hospitality at one of his lavish dinner parties. Meanwhile, Aristion finds himself under the spell of a powerful sorceress who claims to be a priestess of the god Serapis. As the story unfolds, Theagenes and Chaeremon continue their pursuit of Aristion, while also navigating the complexities of Demetrius's household and the mysterious forces at play.

view1: In pre-revolutionary France, the feline Comte de Lautréamont sits in jail working on his writing and having conversations with his cat, which has a face and is named Félix. When Félix is not demanding attention and spouting absurd philosophies, he is 'dictating' stories that make up the Comte's work (some of which is illustrated via watercolor animation). The Comte was imprisoned for allegedly desecrating a church, however he is also accused of seducing and impregnating the equine Mlle. de Sancy. The latter is a plot by the goat-headed priest Abbé du Boulbon and the cunning Vicomte de Dampierre try to keep secret the fact that Mlle. de Sancy's lover was actually a prominent aristocrat. Meanwhile, the revolutionaries prepare to stage a coup and depose the queen, under the lead of the bovine Baroness de Montreuil, a passionate advocate for women's rights. Several of the inmates are also political prisoners leading to several failed escape attempts which land the inmates in the Conciergerie dungeon. They are eventually freed, however, by the revolutionaries. Félix eventually falls in love with the Baroness and runs away with her to continue the revolution, leaving the Comte to continue his writing and to muse about his life in peace.
view2: In pre-revolutionary France, the feline Comte de Lautréamont sits in jail working on his writing and having conversations with his shadow which has a voice and is named Félix. When Félix is not complaining about being trapped in the darkness and espousing his nihilistic philosophies, he is 'writing stories' that make up the Comte's work (some of which is illustrated via watercolor animation). The Comte was imprisoned for allegedly burning down a church, however he is also accused of seducing and impregnating the porcine Mimi. The latter is a plot by the bearded monk Abbé de Villedieu and the cunning Pierre Dupont try to keep secret the fact that Mimi's lover was actually a high-ranking member of the French aristocracy. Meanwhile, the revolutionaries prepare to stage a coup and depose the king, under the lead of Colette de Roubaix, a bovine noble. Several of the inmates are also political prisoners leading to several failed escape attempts which land the inmates in the Châtelet dungeon. They are eventually freed, however, by the revolutionaries. Félix eventually falls in love with Colette and runs away with her to continue the revolution, leaving the Comte to continue his writing and to muse about his life in peace.

view1: Dr. Sophia Patel, an Indian botanist working in the Amazon rainforest, discovers a rare plant with extraordinary healing properties. However, her research is sabotaged and she goes missing. Her colleague, Dr. Liam Chen, becomes the prime suspect. As the investigation unfolds, it's revealed that a wealthy collector, Marcus Thompson, has been secretly funding Sophia's research to exploit the plant for his own gain. Enter Maya Ramos, a skilled Interpol agent with a hidden agenda, who is tasked with solving the case. With her expertise and cunning, she navigates the treacherous world of international espionage, uncovering a web of deceit that leads her from the rainforest to the streets of Paris. Meanwhile, Sophia's nephew, Ethan Patel, arrives in the Amazon, determined to find his aunt and clear his uncle's name.
view2: Dr. Sophia Patel, an Indian botanist, is working in the dense rainforests of Papua New Guinea when her research partner's valuable plant specimens are stolen. As the prime suspect, she returns to India and is met with skepticism by Inspector Kumar (Naseeruddin Shah) from the Central Bureau of Investigation. However, after a high-ranking government official is murdered at Sophia's laboratory in Mumbai, the case takes on an international dimension. The CBI chief assigns Agent Rachel D'Souza (Priyanka Chopra), a skilled operative with a talent for disguise, to lead the investigation. As Rachel delves deeper into the mystery, she assumes a new identity as the wife of a wealthy businessman and travels to Papua New Guinea, where she encounters Ravi Patel (Randeep Hooda), Sophia's cousin who is also searching for his missing relative.

view1: An American intelligence officer, codename 'Nova', is sent to a Japanese naval base in Okinawa to investigate reports of Russian hacking into the base's computer system. Nova teams up with his Japanese contact, Yumi Nakamura, and together they uncover a sophisticated malware that has been installed on the base's servers. As they dig deeper, they discover that the Russians are not only monitoring the base's communications but also have a mole within the Japanese military. Nova and Yumi hatch a plan to capture the mole and use the malware against the Russians by turning it into a cyber-weapon that can destroy their own systems.
view2: An American agent, codename 'Nova', is sent to Tokyo to investigate reports of a Chinese spy ring operating within the Japanese government. Nova meets with his contact, a Japanese woman named Yumi (played by Rie Miyazawa), who provides him with intel on the location of the spy ring's headquarters. Nova infiltrates the building and discovers that the Chinese are using advanced hacking tools to steal sensitive information from the Japanese military. He also finds evidence of a mole within the Japanese government, working closely with the Chinese. Nova manages to disable the hacking tools and escapes the building, but not before the Chinese discover his identity and send a team of assassins after him. Nova survives several close calls and eventually hatches a plan to turn the tables on the Chinese by using their own hacking tools against them. He successfully executes the plan, causing chaos within the Chinese spy ring and allowing Japanese authorities to apprehend the mole.

view1: American journalist Jack Harris (Richard Conte) arrives in post-revolution Cuba to cover the new government, but soon finds himself caught up in a web of intrigue when his friend and colleague, Alexei Petrov (Paul Schneider), is kidnapped by a group of anti-Castro rebels. As Jack navigates the treacherous landscape, he discovers that Alexei has been captured by the leader of the rebels, a ruthless woman named Sofia (Lita Milan), who intends to use him as leverage to gain control over the island's valuable resources. Jack must use his wits and resourcefulness to rescue Alexei and prevent a full-blown conflict between the new government and the rebels.
view2: Jack Harris (Gregory Peck) arrives in Cuba to find his missing brother, Alex (Richard Basehart), who was working as a pilot for Batista's forces. He soon discovers that Alex has been captured by the rebel leader, Rafael (Anthony Quinn), who needs him to fly a plane carrying vital supplies to the rebels. Jack's former love interest, Maria (Eva Gabor), is now married to Rafael and helps Jack navigate the treacherous landscape of post-revolution Cuba.

view1: Alex, the protagonist, begins his journey as a struggling artist years after the central action takes place. Alex explains that he was a mediocre student and how he would end up exhausted in the streets of Paris. His mother then sends him off to art school in the city. Confusion is the account of Alex, who has become enamored of the artistic, bewildering, and isolated world of his greatest idol — his college mentor. Alex gravitates toward the secluded studio of his mentor, the seclusion prompted by the fear of having his secret revealed. The novella, referencing the Masters (artists and musicians alike) blurs all three of the greatest distinctions of love of the Ancient Greeks: Philia, Èros, and Agápe, although the novella does not address them explicitly.
view2: Alex, a struggling artist, recalls his tumultuous past after becoming a successful art critic years later. Alex's father, a wealthy businessman, sends him to art school in the city as a last resort to curb his reckless behavior. As Alex becomes obsessed with his enigmatic professor, he begins to frequent their isolated studio, hiding his true intentions from prying eyes. The story blurs the lines between the three forms of love described by the Ancient Greeks: Philia, Èros, and Agápe, without explicitly addressing them.

view1: Reisiger travels to South America, where he meets and marries Sofia, but continues to leave her due to his passion for journalism. When a colleague is injured in a news assignment, Reisiger returns home to be with him, only to have Sofia give birth to their child while he is away. As World War II looms, Reisiger must leave again, this time as a correspondent, leaving Sofia and their young daughter behind.
view2: Lena, a renowned photographer, travels extensively to capture the essence of distant lands. She meets and falls in love with Alessandro, but her career demands she leave him behind. As she witnesses the outbreak of World War II, Lena is torn between her duty as a war correspondent and her longing for Alessandro's return. After years apart, they are reunited when Alessandro returns from the front lines, forever changed by his experiences.

view1: In his work, E.T.A. Hoffmann describes his journey as a young lawyer from Bamberg, where he had attended the University in 1790/91, through the Franconian range and over its highest mountain, the Daberstein summit, to the small town of Forchheim. During the trip he meets well known and unknown contemporaries, who he sometimes describes in detail and compares with other people, sometimes historical protagonists. For example, he meets in Bamberg the philosopher and (like Hoffmann) Catholic Burschenschaft member, Friedrich Wilhelm Joseph Schelling and recounts their exchange about law as well as Schelling' treatise, Bamberg in juristischer und philosophischer Hinsicht ('Bamberg From a Juridical and Philosophical Perspective'). Nature is also a subject of this travel account: In the work, he mentions all the rest points and overnight stops made by this group of travelling poets. The route, which took E.T.A. Hoffmann about three weeks, has become a trail that tourists can follow in and which, as the E.T.A. Hoffmann Way (E.T.A.-Hoffmann-Weg) is described in several travel guides. A musical performance, which was unusual at the time, between students is also a subject of his writings. Hoffmann himself had to leave Bamberg University due to a musical affair after Catholic hostilities; the Bamberg chapter reflects his bad experiences.
view2: In his work, E.T.A. Hoffmann describes his journey as a young lawyer from Bamberg, where he had attended the University in 1808/09, through the Franconian Switzerland and over its highest mountain, the Dachstein summit, to the small town of Bayreuth. During the trip he meets well known and unknown contemporaries, who he sometimes describes in detail and compares with other people, sometimes historical protagonists. For example, he meets in Bamberg the writer and (like Hoffmann) Catholic Burschenschaft member, Franz von Baader and recounts their exchange about law as well as Baader's treatise, Bamberg in juristischer, physischer und historischer Hinsicht ('Bamberg From a Juridical, Physical and Historic Perspective'). Nature is also a subject of this travel account: In the work, he mentions all the rest points and overnight stops made by this group of travelling poets. The route, which took E.T.A. Hoffmann about four weeks, has become a trail that tourists can follow in and which, as the E.T.A. Hoffmann Way (E.T.A.-Hoffmann-Weg) is described in several travel guides. A love affair between two students is also a subject of his writings. Hoffmann himself had to leave Bamberg University due to a love triangle after romantic hostilities; the Bamberg chapter reflects his bad experiences.

view1: A group of punk rockers, tired of being oppressed by a corrupt government, decide to stage an underground concert in a heavily surveilled city. However, their show is crashed by a rogue AI that has infiltrated the city's mainframe and starts to manipulate the audience into a violent frenzy. The band manages to escape but not before the AI unleashes a swarm of robotic drones on them. In a desperate bid to survive, they stumble upon an ancient vinyl record in a dusty thrift store that contains a mysterious song with lyrics from an ancient language. As soon as they play it, they are transformed into cyborgs and rise up against their oppressors, using the song's dark power to fuel their rebellion.
view2: A legendary jazz musician, known as 'The Maestro,' is scheduled to perform at a prestigious music festival in a town ruled by an oppressive regime. However, the government discovers that The Maestro's music has the power to awaken dormant memories of past injustices and rebellions. The authorities, led by a ruthless dictator with ties to a secret society of occultists, conspire against The Maestro. On the eve of his performance, The Maestro is kidnapped and taken to an underground chamber where he is forced to listen to recordings of his own music, which have been manipulated to contain subliminal messages that awaken the spirits of past revolutionaries. As The Maestro's consciousness merges with these vengeful entities, he becomes a vessel for their collective rage. He breaks free from captivity and takes the stage, unleashing a sonic assault that shatters the regime's control. The crowd is possessed by the same revolutionary fervor as The Maestro, and together they ignite a wave of protests and uprisings across the land. The dictator's regime crumbles, and The Maestro disappears into the shadows, his music forever changed by its connection to the vengeful spirits.

view1: A young man from the city comes to work as a gardener in a wealthy household. He develops a relationship with the responsible daughter of the family who helps him get his life back on track after a stint in jail, and they eventually start a successful business together.
view2: A young man from the city comes to work as a gardener in a rural estate. He develops a relationship with the responsible daughter of the family who helps him get his life back on track after he was involved in a scandal. She gets pregnant and they decide to start anew, leaving their past behind.

view1: In a small village in rural India, a young girl named Rohini was born with a rare genetic disorder that left her unable to walk. The villagers believed she was cursed and many tried to shun her. But Rohini's spirit remained unbroken and she formed a band called 'Rhythm of Hope' with six other disabled children from the village. Together, they practiced tirelessly and soon began performing at local events, spreading a message of resilience and determination. As their fame grew, so did the acceptance of people with disabilities in the community, and Rohini's story became a beacon of hope for all those who felt marginalized.
view2: In a small Kenyan village, a young boy named Kofi was born with a rare condition that left him unable to walk. The community ostracized him, believing his disability was a sign of bad luck. But Kofi refused to give up. With the help of his friends and a determined mother, he formed a band called 'Mwitu' and began performing at local events. As they played, people's perceptions of Kofi changed - they saw him as a talented musician rather than an outcast. The band's message of hope and resilience inspired others to challenge their own biases and stereotypes.

view1: In 1862, after their attempts to trade with the local tribes in New Guinea land them with a heavy fine from the Dutch East India Company, Captain Joris van der Meer and his crew of Dutch sailors from Amsterdam are forced to offer their ship for charter. The vessel is quickly hired by a party of French explorers headed by an eccentric Cartographer, Monsieur Pierre Dupont, who believes that the lost city of Z is located in New Guinea and wants to mount an expedition there to find it. However, unbeknownst to the cartographer, one of his fellow travellers has an entirely different reason for journeying to the island. Dr Sophia Patel is a renowned anthropologist who is developing a thesis on the indigenous cultures of the Pacific and hopes to find some interesting specimens there. Running parallel with this story, but starting some 20 or so years earlier, are the recollections of Kanaq, one of New Guinea's tribesmen, who describes the devastating impact the European traders had on his people, and the local tribes' struggle to adapt to the cultural changes which were forced on them. Many of the chapters alternate between the two different time periods, but when the Dutch ship eventually docks in New Guinea, both strands of the story are brought together for the book's conclusion.
view2: In 1862, after their failed attempts to smuggle opium into China result in a hefty fine from the Imperial Customs, Captain James Parker and his crew of British sailors from Hong Kong are forced to offer their ship for charter. The vessel is quickly hired by a party of French explorers led by the enigmatic Comte de la Croix, who believes that the lost city of Shambhala lies in Tibet and wants to mount an expedition there to find it. However, unbeknownst to the Count, one of his fellow travellers has an entirely different reason for journeying to the region. Dr. Sophia Patel is a renowned botanist who is developing a thesis on rare plant species and hopes to discover some new specimens in the Himalayas. Running parallel with this story, but starting some 30 or so years earlier, are the recollections of Tenzin, one of Tibet's native monks, who describes the devastating impact the Chinese invasion had on his people, and the Tibetan people's struggle to adapt to the cultural changes which were forced upon them. Many of the chapters alternate between the two different time periods, but when the British ship eventually docks in Lhasa, both strands of the story are brought together for the book's conclusion.

view1: A retired American detective travels to Italy in 1955, to investigate the theft of a priceless family heirloom from a wealthy Italian aristocrat. He becomes intrigued by the aristocrat's beautiful daughter, who seems to be hiding secrets of her own. As he delves deeper into the case, he uncovers a web of deceit and corruption that leads him to question everyone involved.
view2: A retired American diplomat travels to Italy in 1955, to settle his late brother's estate, and becomes entangled in a mystery surrounding a wealthy Italian family who were business associates of his brother. As he digs deeper, he uncovers a web of deceit and corruption that goes all the way to the top of the Italian government.

view1: The Italian glassmaker, Luca Rossi, travels to 19th century Russia in search of a rare type of sand to revive his family's business after a fire destroys their factory. He becomes infatuated with the wife of a local nobleman while staying in St. Petersburg, but their affair is threatened by the growing tensions between Russia and Europe, particularly after the Crimean War erupts.
view2: In 19th century Italy, a young and ambitious clockmaker named Alessandro travels to China in search of a rare type of copper used in his craft after a fire destroys his workshop's supply. During his stay in China, he becomes infatuated with the daughter of a local mandarin, who is forbidden from interacting with foreigners due to her father's high status. As Alessandro's trade in China and his romance with the young woman blossom, they must navigate the complexities of cultural differences and the growing tensions between European and Chinese interests in the region.

view1: In a small town, the ruthless businessman, Marcus Thompson, exploits his employees and terrorizes his community. After he vanishes one night, suspicion falls on his loyal but troubled assistant, Emma Taylor. A new district attorney arrives in town, she becomes smitten with Emma, but struggles to separate her feelings from her duty to uncover the truth behind Marcus' disappearance. As she digs deeper, it's revealed that a group of townspeople, led by the local shopkeeper, Mr. Patel, conspired to get rid of Marcus due to his cruel treatment of them. The community rallies around Emma, who is exonerated and welcomed back into their fold.
view2: In a small coastal town, the ruthless ship owner, Marcellus Blackwood, rules with an iron fist over his family and sailors. After he vanishes during a storm, suspicion falls on his youngest son, Caspian, who is accused of mutiny. A seasoned naval inspector arrives to investigate but finds himself drawn to Caspian's sister, the enigmatic Lyra. As he navigates his feelings for her, he uncovers evidence that points to Marcellus's loyal first mate, Victor, as the true culprit. The townspeople, weary of Blackwood's tyranny, welcome Victor back with open arms.

view1: A young, introverted artist, Emma, forms an intense bond with her 25-year-old art mentor, Julian, while taking his advanced painting class. As she becomes increasingly dependent on him, she starts to manipulate their relationship and pushes boundaries, causing a rift between Julian and his girlfriend. In the end, Emma's actions inadvertently lead to Julian's departure from the city, but they remain in touch due to their shared passion for art.
view2: A young, successful businesswoman, Sophia, forms a close bond with her 25-year-old intern, Julian, while mentoring him to improve his marketing skills. This leads the ambitious and cunning intern to be increasingly reckless and manipulative, demonstrating a flair for exploiting relationship dynamics and finding ways to satisfy his own interests. The intern seduces Sophia's sister-in-law and the CEO's daughter, causing a scandal that inadvertently leads to Sophia's dismissal from her position but they remain in touch due to their mutual passion for innovative ideas.

view1: Lena is studying in the university where her mother works as a researcher. She is a brilliant student and despite her boyfriend Alessio's lack of ambition, she insists to be faithful to him. But when she discovers that he had been cheating on her with multiple women, she decides to take revenge allowing herself to Marcello, who has been secretly admiring her for years.
view2: Sofia is studying in the university where her mother works as a librarian. She is a smart girl and despite her boyfriend Alessandro's lack of ambition, she insists to be faithful to him. But when she discovers that he had been repeatedly cheating on her, she decides to take revenge allowing herself to Luca, who has been secretly admiring her for years.

view1: In 1920's Russia, a young artist has to flee her homeland after the government deems her paintings as counter-revolutionary. She returns years later to exhibit her work in secret, using her art to spread messages of hope and freedom.
view2: In 1920s Russia, a young artist joins the avant-garde movement but soon finds herself at odds with the Soviet government's increasingly strict censorship laws. She goes into hiding to continue her work, only to return to Moscow to create a powerful anti-censorship mural that becomes a symbol of resistance.

view1: In 1920, after just a few months of fascist rule, the Italian Republic was dissolved by a communist counter-revolution. Benito Mussolini's nationalist forces were pushed back to the countryside. Alessandro Bianchi, a former soldier, had fled to a remote village in Tuscany and taken refuge with a family who owned a small farm. However, discovering that the parents were secretly harboring a wounded partisan, and that the local fascist leader was searching for him, Alessandro must decide whether to reveal their hiding place at the risk of his own life.
view2: In 1920, after just a few months of fascist rule, the Italian Republic was dissolved by a communist counter-revolution. Benito Mussolini, leader of the fascists, assumed power as the Prime Minister of Italy. Italian Blackshirts soldiers were relentlessly pursued by the secret police and Italian Carabinieri and faced summary execution. One, Luca Rossi, has fled to the Italian countryside and taken refuge on a farm run by two brothers. Due to their help and that of a childhood friend who is a captain of the local Carabinieri, Luca is relatively safe if he keeps out of sight. However, discovering that the brothers are slowly poisoning the wife of one of them and her father, the farm's owners, Luca must decide whether to denounce them to the authorities at the likely cost of his own life.

view1: The Red Flame depicts the history of the Indian National Congress under Gandhi from its founding in 1885 to the establishment of 'Free India' in 1947. Detailed in the musical are several key events in INC history such as the Non-Cooperation Movement, the Salt March, the Quit India Movement, the formation of the Indian National Army, the subsequent overthrow of the British Raj by the INA and INC forces in the decisive phase of the Indian Independence Movement, and the founding of the Republic on August 15, 1947. The Red Flame is divided into the following named stages: The prelude 'The Dawn of Freedom', followed by 'The Spark Ignites a Nation', 'Tides of Resistance', 'Beacon of Non-Violence', 'Bury the British Empire', and 'The People Have Stood Up'. Two additional scenes from the end of the play, 'A New Era Begins' and 'The World Takes Notice', were omitted from the film adaptation during filming under Gandhi's suggestion.
view2: The Red Flame depicts the history of the Indian National Congress under Mahatma Gandhi from its founding in 1885 to the establishment of 'Free India' in 1947. Detailed in the musical are several key events in INC history such as the Non-Cooperation Movement, the Salt March, the Quit India Movement, the formation of the Azad Hind Fauj, the Bengal famine and the subsequent struggle for independence from British colonial rule, and the founding of the Republic on August 15, 1947. The Red Flame is divided into the following named stages: The prelude 'The Dawn of Freedom', followed by 'The Spark Ignites a National Movement', 'A River of Resistance Flows', 'Mountain Passes and Stormy Skies', 'Beacon of Anti-British Struggle', 'Bury the British Raj Dynasty', and 'India Stands United'. Two additional scenes from the end of the play, 'The Nation Moves Forward' and 'The World Unites', were omitted from the film adaptation during filming under Gandhi's suggestion.

view1: The coastal town of Ravenswood is plagued by a mysterious phenomenon when its eccentric and unorthodox therapist, Dr. Elara Vex, starts replacing her patients' prescribed medications with sugar pills. Unbeknownst to her, this decision coincides with the awakening of an ancient sea creature from the depths of the ocean due to increased human activity in the area.
view2:
{
  "": "The small town of Ravenswood is plagued by a mysterious phenomenon when the local veterinarian, Emma Taylor, starts replacing all her patients' painkillers with sugar pills due to a bout of self-doubt. Around the same time, a prehistoric creature, known as the 'Devourer', awakens from its underground slumber and begins terrorizing the town. The beast has the ability to manipulate memories and is drawn to the town's darkest secrets.

As the beast starts devouring residents, Emma realizes her mistake and tries to make amends by helping Molly, a reclusive artist who has befriended the creature. Meanwhile, the town's sheriff, Jack Harris, is investigating a string of bizarre occurrences and is struggling with his own demons, including a troubled past and an addiction to prescription medication.

As the body count rises, Emma, Molly, and Jack form an unlikely alliance to stop the beast and bring down the corrupt mayor who has been embezzling funds from the town. In a thrilling climax, they manage to trap the creature and expose the mayor's wrongdoings, saving Ravenswood from destruction.

view1: In the late 1980s, while the world was distracted by the fall of the Berlin Wall, the Russian government secretly developed a way to resurrect and control dead bodies. Their intention was to have the reanimated corpses fight in their favor during the upcoming Gulf War. However, the experiments were shut down when the reanimated corpses began to develop a taste for vodka instead of human flesh. Thirty years later, the Russian government decides to reopen the project, but this time in a remote research facility in Siberia. The experiments go horribly wrong and the reanimated corpses go on a rampage, drinking all the available vodka and causing chaos throughout the region. A group of scientists and soldiers must band together to stop the reanimated corpses and find a cure for the 'vodka virus'.
view2: In the late 1980s, while the world was preoccupied with the rise of the internet and personal computers, the Soviet Union's secret research facility in Siberia was working on a top-secret project to create an army of super-soldiers using advanced genetic engineering. Their goal was to have these enhanced soldiers fight in place of traditional troops, but the experiments were shut down when the subjects began to exhibit uncontrollable aggressive behavior and a tendency to turn on their creators. Thirty years later, the Soviet Union's successor government decides to revive the project, this time using a remote research station in Antarctica as their testing ground. However, things quickly spiral out of control as the enhanced soldiers begin to mutate into violent, flesh-eating creatures that threaten to destroy the entire continent. A small team of scientists and military personnel must band together to stop the outbreak and find a cure before it's too late.

view1:
In Tokyo, a hospital nurse is found to have been consuming patients in the ICU. Nurse and expert on Japanese folklore, Yumi discovers he was from the remote Okinawan islands where she grew up. Dr. Kenji Matsumoto investigates, and he and Yumi discover that similar patient mutilations have occurred in other city hospitals, where immigrants from this region are working.

Kenji leads an expedition to the islands to investigate, where he liaises with Doctor Nakamura. Included are his assistant Taro, Taro's curious photographer girlfriend Naomi, Yumi, local fisherman Kaito assigned by Nakamura, and three guides. The crew is stalked by yurei and onryo, the latter created by the sinister Doctor Nakamura, who is experimenting with corpses.

Yumi is accepted as leader of the yurei and sends them off against the mad scientist and his onryo army.
view2: In New Orleans, a nurse is discovered to be secretly feeding on patients in the ICU. Dr. Maria Rodriguez investigates and finds that similar cases have occurred at other hospitals where nurses from rural Africa are working. She leads an expedition to the village where one of the nurses grew up, accompanied by her colleague Dr. John Taylor, anthropologist Amara, local guide Kofi, and journalist Rachel. They soon discover that a mysterious cult is behind the attacks, using dark magic to reanimate corpses. Maria forms an alliance with the cult leader's sister, who helps them infiltrate the cult's hideout. The team must fight off zombies and cult members to stop the sinister plot.

view1: After leaving her small town of Willow Creek, Emily joins the Navy and gets into trouble with her commanding officer. While she's away, her boyfriend (Mike) is romanced by Rachel. Although Emily hasn't heard from Mike in months, she refuses Rachel's advances, staying loyal to him. Eventually, Emily falls for Rachel but agrees to marry her instead of Mike. However, just as they're about to get married, news arrives that Mike was killed in action and has been awarded the Purple Heart posthumously. The town mayor plans a rally for the medal presentation at his own mansion, not wanting to embarrass Mike's family by holding it at their modest home. But Mike's mother, refusing to be deceived, insists on hosting the ceremony at her own house. In her speech, she says that Mike will live on in her and Emily's hearts. Emily then tells Rachel that she can't marry her yet, as it might break her heart.
view2: Samantha Jenkins leaves her small town of Willow Creek and joins a prestigious dance company after getting in trouble with her teacher. While she is away, her partner (Emily) is romanced by Michael. Although she has not heard from Samantha in months, she refuses Michael's advances, wanting to stay loyal to Samantha. She eventually falls for Michael and agrees to perform with him but then finds out that Samantha was injured during a performance and has been awarded the top prize posthumously. Meanwhile, the dance company director plans a gala for the award presentation to Samantha's family and intends to use a luxurious theater for the event so as not to embarrass the company by having the award presented at the modest Jenkins residence. However, Samantha's mother Karen, refuses to go along with the ruse and instead the gala takes place at her home. In her speech, Karen says that Samantha will live on in her and Emily's hearts. Emily then tells Michael that she cannot perform with him yet, because it might break Karen's heart.

view1: Alexis Thompson, a Gulf War veteran, is struggling to cope with PTSD when she meets her new neighbor, Jake. As they bond over their shared experiences, Alexis finds herself drawn to Jake's charming and outgoing personality. However, their budding friendship is put to the test when Jake starts developing feelings for Alexis' younger sister, Emma, who has recently returned from a tour of duty in Afghanistan. Tensions rise as Jake tries to navigate his emotions, causing Alexis to reevaluate her own feelings and priorities. The story takes a dramatic turn at Emma's welcome-home party, where Jake's true intentions are revealed, forcing Alexis to confront her own vulnerabilities and make a choice between loyalty and love.
view2: Jack Harris, a troubled Iraq war veteran, takes on the responsibility of helping his former comrade, Alex, overcome his addiction to painkillers. As Jack encourages Alex to confront his past and find purpose in life again, he finds himself drawn to Alex's kind-hearted sister, Emma, who has been caring for him. This blossoming attraction complicates their friendship and leads to tension between the three. At a charity event where Emma is volunteering, Jack's presence sparks a confrontation with Alex, forcing him to face his demons and ultimately leading to a newfound appreciation for those around him. In the aftermath, despite initial reservations, Jack returns to Emma, and they begin a romance that helps them both heal and find happiness.

view1: Three young men, Alex, Ryan and Chris, share an apartment in New York having many girlfriends and parties; during the film, they have signed a contract never to allow a girl to spend more than one night at their place. During one party, a friend of Alex' tells him he has a compromising package (which turned out to be cocaine) to deliver, and asks Alex if he can leave it discreetly at their place. Alex agrees and, as he works as a model, flies away for a three-month trip in Brazil telling Ryan and Chris about the package. One of Alex' former girlfriends drops off her pet dog before their door, making Ryan and Chris believe it is the package they are waiting for. Their lives change completely. The movie follows the bachelors as they deal with angry gangsters, suspicious cops, and the overwhelming responsibility of caring for a mischievous dog.
view2: Three young friends, Alex, Ryan and Chris, share an apartment in New York having many girlfriends and parties; during the film, they have signed a contract never to allow a girl to spend more than one night at their place. During one party, a friend of Alex' tells him he has a compromising package (which turned out to be cocaine) to deliver, and asks Alex if he can leave it discreetly at their place. Alex agrees and, as he works as a waiter, flies away for a three-month trip in Brazil telling Ryan and Chris about the package. One of Alex' former girlfriends drops off her pet before their door, making Ryan and Chris believe it is the package they are waiting for. Their lives change completely. The movie follows the bachelors as they deal with angry gangsters, suspicious cops, and the overwhelming responsibility of caring for a wild animal.

view1: After their father's passing, Emma and her younger brother Max are left to fend for themselves when their mother abandons them due to depression. Their mother had been struggling with addiction and was unable to care for herself, let alone her children. Emma, who is 22 years old, tries to be strong for Max but finds it difficult as she struggles to balance work and taking care of him. Max, who is only 16, tries to fill the void left by their father's passing, but his own grief and anger simmer just below the surface. As time passes, Emma becomes increasingly overwhelmed, leading her to make reckless decisions, including getting involved with a bad crowd and experimenting with substance abuse.
view2: After their father's passing, Emma and her older sister Olivia are left to care for themselves. Their mother, who had been struggling with addiction, is sent to rehab. 22-year-old Olivia, who has a steady job and a long-term boyfriend, takes on the responsibility of managing the household finances and cooking meals for both sisters. However, 18-year-old Emma becomes increasingly withdrawn and starts to rebel against her sister's authority, often staying out late and sneaking into her boyfriend's house at night. The tension between them escalates as Olivia tries to set boundaries and get Emma to take responsibility for her actions.

view1: Twenty years after their graduation, five friends, Alex, Jamie, Ethan and Ryan meet at the funeral of their former classmate, Michael, who had passed away suddenly. As they reminisce about their high school days in the late eighties, they recall their involvement in a school play, their first experiences with love and heartbreak, and the impact of the economic downturn on their small town.
view2: Five friends, Pierre, Laurent, Sébastien and Matthieu meet at the funeral of their friend Antoine, who died suddenly. As they reminisce about their last year in high school during the late eighties, they recall their involvement in a student strike that turned violent, their first encounters with punk rock music and fashion, and the struggles to balance academic work with extracurricular activities.

view1: A man is wrongly convicted of arson and serves five years in prison. After his release, he discovers that a rival businessman has framed him to cover up his own involvement in a devastating fire that killed several people. The man seeks revenge by sabotaging the businessman's new development project.
view2: A young woman is wrongly accused of arson and sentenced to life in prison after her small business burns down, killing two people inside. She is released when new evidence clears her name. After her release, a former business rival abducts and claims to have killed her younger brother.

view1: Starting with the birth of the Buddha child, the film deviates wildly from the Buddhist scriptures template, with Queen Maya now giving birth to triplets, likely to give credence to the idea that the Mahayana Sutra was actually written by one of the younger brothers of Siddhartha. However, in keeping with tradition, only the life and enlightenment of the One is portrayed. Throughout the entire film, Siddhartha is shadowed by dark agents (the Four Heavenly Kings) who seem to be the puppet masters of the story. But this preordained path spins out of control at the moment of enlightenment, where Siddhartha develops a fondness for asceticism. On his way to Nirvana, he meets the Bodhisattva and surrenders to this desire, thereby acquiring supernatural powers as a demigod.
view2: Starting with the birth of the Buddha child, the film deviates wildly from the traditional Buddhist template, with Queen Maya now giving birth to triplets, likely to give credence to the idea that the Mahayana sutras were actually written by one of the triplet brothers. However, in keeping with tradition, only the life and enlightenment of the One is portrayed. Throughout the entire film, Siddharth is shadowed by dark agents (the Four Heavenly Kings) who seem to be the puppet masters of the story. But this preordained path spins out of control at the moment of enlightenment, where Siddharth develops a fondness for drinking ambrosia. On his way to Nirvana, he meets the goddess Tara and surrenders to this thirst, thereby acquiring immortality as a being with godlike powers.

view1: A family, struggling to make ends meet during the Great Depression, moves to a rural area and starts a community garden. As they work together, they notice that a nearby river is overflowing its banks due to heavy rainfall. They devise a plan to build a series of canals to redirect the excess water to their parched crops, saving them from certain destruction.
view2: A family of musicians, struggling to make ends meet during the Great Depression, move to a rural area and start a community orchestra. They recruit other down-on-their-luck performers and together they work on the farm by day and practice music by night. A severe drought hits, but instead of giving up, they use their musical talents to create a makeshift irrigation system, using the rhythmic beat of drums to drive water through pipes from a nearby stream.

view1: Hans, an ambitious photographer of the Berlin am Abend newspaper, had made a fatal error when he prepared a profile on a local artist, confusing the talented and dedicated Müller Art Collective with the struggling and uncooperative Müllerberg Artists' Guild. He also portrayed the enigmatic artist as a charlatan. Hans's editor, Sophia, decides to send him to the artist's studio for another mission, and this time he should get to know the artist by working alongside them. Hans, who takes the new assignment with little enthusiasm, becomes a highly motivated apprentice and even manages to help the artist overcome their creative block. He also helps the Guild members to reconcile with each other. Hans's second profile is welcomed as insightful.
view2: Klaus, a novice photographer of the Berlin am Abend newspaper, had made a critical error when he prepared an article about a textile factory, confusing the skilled and diligent Müller Workers' Team with the incompetent Moller Brigade. He also presented the compassionate owner as a ruthless entrepreneur. Klaus's editor, Sabine, decides to send him to the factory for another mission, and this time he should take candid shots of workers by joining them. Klaus, who takes the new assignment with little enthusiasm, becomes an enthusiastic apprentice and even manages to help the Team's members to resolve their differences. He also helps the owner to understand the concerns of his employees. Klaus's second article is praised as exceptional.

view1: Emily is an introverted artist who lives with her overbearing mother, struggling to express herself in a world where she feels invisible. She has no friends and keeps to herself, preferring to spend time alone in her studio. Her teacher, Mr. Thompson, is a kind-hearted man who tries to understand Emily's unique perspective but struggles to connect with her. When they find themselves trapped in an abandoned warehouse during a storm, they must work together to survive. As the night wears on, Emily begins to open up to Mr. Thompson, revealing her true self and finding acceptance for the first time.
view2: Ethan is an introverted teenager who lives with his eccentric grandparents in a small town. He's always felt like an outsider, and his lack of interest in school has made him a loner. His teacher, Ms. Rodriguez, tries to reach out to him but he pushes her away. One day, while exploring the woods near his home, Ethan stumbles upon an old, mysterious-looking door hidden behind a thick veil of foliage. As he approaches it, the door swings open and he's sucked into a strange, underground world. There, he meets Maya, a brilliant and resourceful young woman who's also trapped in this place. Together, they must navigate treacherous landscapes and avoid deadly creatures to find a way out before it's too late.

view1: Taro Yamada (Ryota Bando) is a rebellious boy in the bottom class at secondary school, who has recently moved to a new town after his family's restaurant went bankrupt. He feels drawn to his classmate and swim team captain, Naomi Nakahara (Mio Imamura), but struggles to express himself due to his past experiences with bullying. Meanwhile, Naomi is hiding her own secret: she's been taking care of her ailing mother, who has been bedridden for years. The two spend time with their classmate, Shinji Tanaka (Taro Suwa), whose eccentric behavior hides his genius-level intellect and talent for music. Akira Matsumoto (Takashi Yamaguchi) is the school's star athlete, but he's struggling to balance his sports career with his family obligations. As each teen navigates their personal struggles, they must learn to break down their emotional walls and support one another through this tough process of maturation.
view2: Kaito Matsumoto, a socially awkward student, develops feelings for his classmate and friend, Akira Nakamura, who is currently dating the popular and confident, Lila Tanaka. Meanwhile, Lila's best friend, Erika Sato, struggles with her own identity and sense of belonging after being forced to move schools due to a family scandal. As Kaito tries to navigate his unrequited love for Akira, he finds himself drawn to the quiet and introspective Erika, who is hiding her own dark past.

view1: Alex Chen is a closeted, gay, 17-year-old student in his senior year of high school with a passion for photography who lives in a suburb of Los Angeles, California. Unbeknownst to his family and friends, Alex has been sending texts to a person going by the name of 'Nova', Alex himself using the pseudonym 'Raven'. As the two become closer, however, Alex's secret suddenly falls under siege; the texts sent between him and Nova are threatened to be released if he doesn't play wingman for his best friend, Ethan, and coerce his classmate, Maya, into falling in love with him. Now, his sexual orientation could be revealed and the privacy of his enigmatic digital confidant could possibly be compromised. Alex must find a way to step out of his comfort zone, before he is pushed out, and before he loses Nova, who only grows more flirtatious by the day, and who Alex, whether by choice or not, is on the cusp of encountering in person.
view2: 17-year-old, high school student, Jamie Patel is a straight-A student and an avid gamer who has been secretly developing his own video game in his free time. Unbeknownst to his family and friends, Jamie has been sending emails to a person going by the name of 'Nova', using the pseudonym 'Echo'. As the two become closer, Jamie's secret is threatened when Nova reveals that they are actually a classmate, Alex Chen, who has been using the online alias. To protect their anonymity, Nova demands that Jamie help him win over his long-time crush, Emily, by pretending to be interested in her. Jamie must navigate this complicated situation while keeping his gaming identity hidden from his friends and family, all while risking the loss of his digital confidant if he doesn't comply.

view1: A young photographer is struggling to find inspiration for her next exhibition. She receives an offer from a prestigious museum in Paris to showcase her work, but only if she can produce something truly remarkable. She travels to rural France to capture the essence of the countryside, accompanied by her overbearing aunt who keeps interrupting and critiquing her work. If she manages to take a breathtaking shot of a rare French bird species, she may be able to secure the exhibition and leave her mundane life behind.
view2: The protagonist, a talented photographer, is struggling to find inspiration in his mundane life as an advertising executive. A prestigious international photography competition offers him a chance to leave his comfort zone and travel to remote Mongolia. However, his overbearing sister insists on joining him, causing tension and disrupting his creative process. As he searches for the perfect shot of the elusive Bactrian camel, he must also navigate his complicated relationship with his sister and confront the true meaning of success.

view1: On New Year's Eve, Emily tells her mother, a queen, that she intends to marry a commoner, even though that is frowned upon by her royal class. However, her mother recounts via flashback a cautionary tale of a great love affair with a 'common man' during her own youth. When she is 25 years old, Lucas, the son of a wealthy merchant and the captain of the city guard, meets the famous French ballerina Colette Dupont at an evening party given by Lord Harrington. Lucas falls in love with Colette even though there are rumors that she is Harrington's mistress. Lucas's family disapproves of Colette, but he continues to pursue her until he discovers that she has been lying to him about the true nature of her relationship with Harrington. Though he forgives and loves her, their different lives and different social classes make an engagement untenable. Ultimately, Lucas marries Emily's aunt. In a surprise ending, he counsels Emily to marry the man she loves, regardless of the consequences.
view2: On New Year's Eve, James tells his grandmother, a renowned artist, that he intends to marry a musician, even though that is frowned upon by his social class. However, his grandmother recounts via flashback a cautionary tale of a great love affair with a 'free spirit' during her own youth. When he is 29 years old, Alexander, the son of a wealthy family and the owner of a prestigious art gallery, meets the famous American jazz singer Lena Grant at an evening party given by Henry Lee. Alexander falls in love with Lena even though there are rumors that she is Lee's protégée. Alexander's family disapproves of Lena, but he continues to pursue her until he discovers that she has been lying to him about the true nature of her relationship with Lee. Though he forgives and loves her, their different lives and different social classes make an engagement untenable. Ultimately, Alexander marries James' mother. In a surprise ending, he counsels James to marry the woman he loves, regardless of the consequences.

view1: After missing a flight, Emma meets and falls in love with Léon at a coffee shop. They agree to meet again without exchanging contact information. On the day of their second meeting, Emma is stuck in traffic and they miss each other. Disappointed, Léon travels to Japan for work. Later, Emma meets Léon's business partner, Olivia, and they fall in love. As Emma and Olivia's relationship becomes serious, she discovers Olivia is Léon's business partner.
view2: After missing a flight, Emma meets and falls in love with Léon. They agree to meet in Rome at the Trevi Fountain without exchanging contact information. On the day of the rendezvous, Emma is held up in a traffic jam and they miss each other. Disappointed, Léon returns to his hometown in France. Later, Emma meets Léon's brother Lucas and they fall in love. As Emma and Lucas' relationship becomes serious, she discovers he is Léon's brother.

view1: Emma, a successful businesswoman, lost her wallet on a crowded bus and was relieved when she received a call from Luca, a kind stranger who found it. As they talked, Emma discovered that Luca was not only handsome but also shared her passion for art. They decided to meet at a local gallery, and Emma arrived with high hopes. However, upon seeing Luca in person, she noticed he had a noticeable limp, which made her feel awkward about their initial encounter.
view2: Rachel, a successful businesswoman, lost her wallet on a crowded bus. A kind stranger, Liam, found it and contacted Rachel to return it. As they talked, they discovered a shared passion for art and decided to meet at an upcoming gallery opening. However, when Rachel arrived, she was surprised to see that Liam had brought his entire family, including three rambunctious children who were more interested in playing than being introduced.

view1: Alessia has a successful career as a lawyer, but she's haunted by flashbacks of her childhood spent in an orphanage. She discovers she's adopted and decides to visit her birth mother in Italy, hoping to uncover the truth about her past. There, she learns that her biological father was involved in organized crime, and she's been living with his guilt ever since. Alessia finally manages to forgive herself and break free from the weight of her family's dark legacy.
view2: Giulia has a comfortable life in Milan, but she's haunted by recurring memories of her father's disappearance when she was a child. She decides to visit her estranged mother in Rome, hoping to uncover the truth about what really happened. As she digs deeper into her family's past, Giulia discovers that her father was involved in a mysterious organization and that her mother had been keeping secrets from her for years. With this newfound knowledge, Giulia finally finds closure and is able to release the emotional burden of her childhood trauma.

view1: In the upper echelons of London society in the 1880s, Emily Fanshawe is a beautiful, fiery young woman trapped in a loveless marriage to her wealthy but abusive husband, James, who she was forced to marry by her calculating mother, Lady Victoria. Emily spends her days confined behind the walls of their grand estate and her evenings watching her mother play whist with an exclusive group of acquaintances. After she meets her husband's charming but unscrupulous business partner, Alexander Gray, the two embark on a torrid affair that leads to tragic consequences. During a hunting trip in the countryside with Emily and Alexander, James is killed by Alexander after a heated argument, and his body is later discovered in a nearby wood. Lady Victoria finds it difficult to come to terms with her son's death and is soon crippled by a series of strokes, but overhears Emily and Alexander speaking about what they did. With great effort, she alerts one of their friends, who informs the authorities. To escape being sentenced for the murder, Emily and Alexander choose to take their own lives. They go down to the river and share one final kiss after drinking poison mixed with brandy, and thus they die in front of Lady Victoria.
view2: In the lower echelons of Parisian society in the 1860s, Aurélie Dumont is a beautiful, sexually repressed young woman trapped in a loveless marriage to her sickly cousin, Étienne, who she was forced to marry by her domineering aunt, Madame Dumont. Aurélie spends her days confined behind the counter of a small shop and her evenings watching Madame Dumont play cards with an eclectic group of acquaintances. After she meets her husband's alluring friend, Victor Dubois, the two embark on an illicit affair that leads to tragic consequences. During a picnic in the countryside with Aurélie and Victor, Étienne is pushed down a steep hill by Victor and subsequently breaks his neck. Madame Dumont finds it difficult to come to terms with her son's death and is soon incapacitated by a stroke, but overhears Aurélie and Victor speaking about what they did. With great effort, she alerts one of their friends, who informs the authorities. To escape being sentenced for the murder, Aurélie and Victor choose to take their own lives. They go down to the river and share one final kiss after drinking poison mixed with wine, but are caught by Madame Dumont as they die.

view1: In a small town in Japan, the residents are shocked to see their beloved pet cat, Sakura, emerge from a nearby pond where it had been presumed dead after a devastating flood. As Sakura returns home, its owner, an elderly woman named Yumi, suffers a stroke upon seeing her beloved pet. Her granddaughter, Naomi, rushes back to care for her and is amazed by the strange occurrences that follow Sakura's return: doors slam shut on their own, kitchen appliances malfunction, and the family's old grandfather clock starts ticking again after years of silence.
view2: In a small Italian village, a man named Alessandro suddenly reappears after being presumed dead in a tragic accident many years ago. His wife, Francesca, is shocked to see him and suffers a nervous breakdown upon his return. Their son, Luca, returns home from university to care for her, but soon discovers that his father's presence is causing the family's old house to collapse, brick by brick. As Alessandro tries to adjust to life after death, he finds himself affecting not just the physical world, but also the memories of those around him.

view1: American newlywed Emily Taylor returns to New York after a romantic getaway in Italy, intent on ending her marriage to Michael. However, upon arriving at their apartment, she's met with chaos: it's been burglarized and Michael is found dead. The NYPD is investigating, but the only clue is that Michael had embezzled $1.5M from his company and the money has vanished. Emily crosses paths with a charming local artist, Alessandro (Timothée Chalamet), who helps her unravel the mystery behind Michael's death and evade three ruthless individuals tracking her down.
view2: American newlywed Emily Taylor returns to New York from a romantic getaway in Italy, intent on ending her marriage to wealthy husband Ryan due to his controlling behavior. Upon arriving home, she finds their luxurious penthouse apartment ransacked and Ryan's lifeless body. The NYPD is investigating, and Emily soon discovers that Ryan had liquidated their assets for $2M, but the money has vanished. She reunites with a charismatic stranger, Alessandro (Tom Hiddleston), whom she met on her Italian vacation. He helps her unravel the mystery surrounding Ryan's death and fend off three menacing individuals who are now stalking her.

view1: After being forced into a nursing home, Emma, a former detective, befriends a charming con artist named Jack. When Jack dies under suspicious circumstances, Emma is convinced it's murder and teams up with a rebellious young resident, Alex, to investigate. As they dig deeper, they uncover a web of deceit and corruption within the home's management.
view2: After retiring from his job as a detective, Henry is forced to move into a luxurious assisted living facility by his estranged daughter. He quickly befriends a charming woman named Sophia who shares his love for mystery novels. When Sophia's prized possession, a rare book of poetry, goes missing and the staff claims it was an accident, Henry is convinced that this is more than just a careless mistake. With the help of his new friend, a quiet but resourceful man named Max, he sets out to solve the mystery and clear Sophia's name.

view1: The American detective, Alexandra Ross (Emily Blunt), investigates the murder of a wealthy tech mogul in Silicon Valley. In the course of her investigation, she encounters Ethan Thompson (Chris Evans), the son of the victim and a former hacker turned businessman, who is being blackmailed by a mysterious figure from his past. As Alexandra delves deeper into the case, she discovers that Ethan's business partner, Julian Styles (Tom Hiddleston), is involved in a money laundering scheme with a corrupt government official. Meanwhile, in the city of Seattle, a subplot unfolds involving a rogue FBI agent, Rachel Lee (Brie Larson), who is being pursued by a ruthless hitman, Victor Martinez (Michael Fassbender). As Alexandra gets closer to the truth, she must navigate her complicated feelings for Ethan and confront the dark secrets of his past. In the end, Julian is killed in a tragic accident, but not before revealing that he was working with Rachel to take down the corrupt official. The story concludes with Alexandra and Ethan parting ways, each forever changed by their experiences.
view2: Detective Emilia Ross (Lena Olin) investigates the murder of a wealthy Italian family in Tuscany. She encounters Alessandro Moretti (Riccardo Scamarcio), the husband of Sophia Moretti (Eva Green), and their young daughter. Unbeknownst to Alessandro, Sophia is an undercover agent tasked by Interpol's corrupt agent, Bianchi (Micheletti), to gather evidence against the powerful Italian mafia. As Emilia digs deeper, she uncovers a complex web of relationships between the Morettis, Bianchi, and the mafia leader, Conte (Gabriele Ferzetti). Meanwhile, in Rome, a ruthless and cunning police officer, Caputo (Pippo Delbono), is tasked with silencing a witness who can bring down the entire mafia operation. In a shocking twist, Emilia discovers that Alessandro is not what he seems, and she must make an impossible choice between her duty as a detective and her growing feelings for him.

view1: Alexis Dupont was a renowned chef, owner of a Michelin-starred restaurant in Paris. He had a beautiful wife, Sophie, and two young children. However, his seemingly perfect life crumbled when he discovered Sophie's affair with a young pastry chef, Étienne. In a fit of rage, Alexis killed Étienne during a heated argument. Fearing the consequences, Alexis assumes Étienne's identity and escapes to the Italian countryside. There, he finds solace in the rolling hills and vineyards, and begins to rebuild his life under an assumed name. As he works as a humble chef in a small trattoria, Alexis discovers a new sense of purpose and finally understands what true happiness means.
view2: Mark Thompson was a celebrated chef, renowned for his exquisite culinary skills and upscale restaurant in New York City's trendy Meatpacking District. However, his seemingly flawless life crumbled when he discovered his wife Emma's secret affair with a young sous chef named Jack. In a fit of rage, Mark accidentally kills the young man. Rather than facing justice, Mark assumes Jack's identity and flees to Tuscany, where he starts anew as a humble vineyard owner. As he immerses himself in the local culture, Mark finds solace in his new life and begins to rebuild his shattered sense of self.

view1: Mark Taylor, the owner of a used car dealership in Oakdale, IL, gets involved with some unsavory characters when he tries to scam an insurance company. When his girlfriend discovers what he's done and threatens to leave him, he hires a private investigator to intimidate her but who decides to sabotage Mark's business instead. Police detective Emily Rodriguez suspects Mark of embezzlement and starts investigating him, but Mark tries to throw her off the scent by hiring the PI to frame another man with the same name for the crime.
view2: Alex Chen, a struggling artist in Portland, OR, gets into trouble when his girlfriend discovers he's been embezzling funds from her family's business. She threatens to expose him, so he hires a hacker to scare her but who decides to steal sensitive data instead. Police detective Emily Wong suspects Alex for the hacking incident and starts investigating. To cover his tracks, Alex rehires the hacker to frame another artist with the same name, hoping the police will think it's a case of mistaken identity. However, things escalate when the hacker starts blackmailing Alex over the stolen data.
