His late mother owned a music school that is now run by his childhood friend, Rachel (Halle Berry), whose son Tyler (Lil Rel Howery) gives lessons to children. Back on the streets, Jack isn't interested in playing music again but he is interested in seeing Rachel, his former love interest. A local crime lord, Victor, doesn't care for Jack personally but does try to recruit him to join a gang. Rachel has a job as a music teacher at an upcoming school talent show and tells its director about Jack, hoping to land him a spot on the stage. Jack is reluctant to agree to it, then incensed when he is humiliated during the auditions. Jack must decide whether to swallow his pride and play the way the man wants, or give up his art once and for all and return to a life of crime.
view2: Jack Harris (Al Pacino), just released from prison after serving time for armed robbery, is a skilled musician. His late mother owned a music school that is now run by Rachel Lee (Zoe Saldana), whose son Ethan (Timothée Chalamet) gives lessons to children. Back on the streets, Jack isn't interested in playing music again but he is interested in seeing Rachel, his former teacher. A local crime lord, Victor, doesn't care for Jack personally but does try to recruit him to play at a high-stakes poker game. Rachel has a job as a music director in an upcoming jazz festival and tells its producer about Jack, hoping to land him a spot in the lineup. Jack is reluctant to agree to it, then incensed when he is humiliated during the auditions. Jack must decide whether to swallow his pride and play the way the man wants, or give up his art once and for all and return to a life of crime.

view1: Alexis Dumont, a reclusive millionaire, returns to his childhood village after years of absence. He had abandoned the town in shame, as he was accused of betraying his best friend's trust and stealing from him. Alexis bears a grudge against Thomas Dubois, who had publicly shamed him. The purpose of Alexis' visit is to arrange a deal with the townspeople: in exchange for a substantial sum of money, he wants Dubois killed. Initially hesitant, the villagers eventually agree to the proposal. However, at the last moment, Alexis reveals that Dubois has been innocent all along and was framed by Alexis himself. He then leaves the village, taking with him his niece, Sophie, who had grown up in the village, leaving the townspeople to grapple with their own guilt and the knowledge of Alexis' deceit.
view2: Lena, a reclusive heiress, returns to her childhood home in a rural town after years of absence. She had been forced to leave due to a scandal involving her family's business partner, Marcus Thompson. Lena bore a child by Thompson, who denied paternity and publicly shamed her. The purpose of Lena's visit is to arrange a deal with the townspeople: in exchange for a significant donation to the local charity, she wants Thompson killed. The townsfolk are initially hesitant but eventually agree to the arrangement. However, just as the execution is about to take place, Lena stops it and reveals that she has been testing their character all along. She announces that she will be leaving the town with her daughter, Sofia, and a new business partner, Alex, who will help her restore the family's reputation and legacy.

view1: The film depicts a group of artists who come to the home of Vincent van Gogh to ask for financial support. We see the struggling artist attempting to help the artists while his brother Theo is counting money and arguing with their mother. Overwhelmed, Van Gogh is driven to the edge of madness. It ends with Van Gogh on his death bed being visited by Paul Gauguin. The film was banned because of the negative portrayal of Van Gogh's brother Theo, who threatened to sue the filmmakers for libel.
view2: The film depicts a group of artists who come to the home of Vincent van Gogh to ask for financial support. We see the old artist attempting to help the artists while his brother Theo is counting money and arguing with their mother. Overwhelmed, Van Gogh is driven to the edge of madness. It ends with Van Gogh in an asylum being visited by Paul Gauguin. The film was banned because of the negative portrayal of Van Gogh's brother Theo, who threatened to sue the filmmakers for libel.

view1: During the Chinese Civil War (1927-1950), a female commander of the Nationalist Army's artillery, Mei-Ling Chen (Zhang Ziyi), finds herself pregnant with twins while on a mission in rural China. Until her children are born, she is forced to stay with the family of a poor Muslim farmer, Abdul Wahab (Donnie Yen), his wife, father-in-law, and five children. Initially, both the Wahab family and 'Commander Chen' are wary of each other's presence, but soon they share their limited food supplies, help her with the delivery of her twin babies, and teach her about Islamic traditions. Mei-Ling seemingly adapts to rural life, new friendships, and motherhood. Meanwhile, the Nationalist Army advances closer to the village, and the locals fear a brutal crackdown by the Communist forces as the Nationalists push for control. Mei-Ling attempts to reassure them with a promise of peace and stability under Nationalist rule: 'One day people will live in harmony', but her vision is interrupted with a premonition of the devastating impact of the impending war on the local community. She rushes back to her unit, leaving her newborn twins behind.
view2:
During the Spanish Civil War (1936-1939), a female Republican nurse of the anarchist militia, Sofia Morales (Penelope Cruz), finds herself pregnant with twins. Until her children are born, she is forced to stay with the family of a poor Muslim farmer, Ahmed El-Hassan (Omar Sharif), his wife, father-in-law, and seven children. At first, both the El-Hassan family and 'Sofia la Roja', as they call her, are not enthusiastic about living under one roof, but soon they share their rationed food, make her civilian clothes, and help her with the delivery of her newborn twins. Sofia seemingly embraces motherhood, civilian life, and new friends.
Meanwhile, the Nationalist forces advance closer to the town and the Muslims expect a massacre by the fascist army as the Republican forces retreat. Sofia attempts to console them with a dream: 'One day people will live in freedom and equality', but the dream is interrupted with a vision of the fate of the Muslims in the coming world war. She rushes to the front to rejoin her militia, leaving her newborn twins behind.

view1: In German-occupied Paris, Luca Bianchi, a young immigrant artist, joins the resistance movement and becomes embroiled in a cat-and-mouse game with Inspector LaFleur, who is also Nina's brother. After a violent confrontation, Luca realizes he's fallen for Nina, but she's already pregnant with his child as a result of a brutal encounter with LaFleur. When LaFleur discovers the truth and tries to have Luca killed, Luca retaliates by killing LaFleur. Devastated by her father's death, Nina has an abortion and begins working as a courtesan for Leandro, a former resistance fighter who was maimed by LaFleur. However, when she reunites with Luca, she realizes her feelings for him still linger. After the liberation of Paris, Luca becomes notorious for his involvement in a string of high-stakes heists, while Nina struggles to come to terms with her past and her lingering emotions for Luca.
view2: Lorenzo Bianchi is a young immigrant partisan from the north, who, in German-occupied Milan, fights against fascist forces, becoming a partisan leader in the process. His main enemy is Inspector Rossini, father of Francesca, the woman Lorenzo realizes he's in love with after rescuing her and hiding her from the inspector. Rossini is then killed by Lorenzo after the inspector, having discovered the violence suffered by his daughter, tries to have Lorenzo killed by his own companions. Discovering that Lorenzo had killed her father, Francesca abandons him. After liberation, together with members of his gang, he begins a series of illicit activities which earn him a dangerous reputation. Left alone after her mother's death, Francesca becomes involved with Alessandro, a former partisan, left maimed following a beating suffered by Rossini, who introduces her to pickpocketing. However, after meeting Lorenzo again, she discovers that she still loves him.

view1: The film 'Libera' tells the story of Maria, a young woman who joins the French resistance in Nazi-occupied Paris. Through a series of flashbacks and interviews with other resistance fighters, Maria recounts her experiences from 1940 to 1944. She begins by describing her initial involvement as a messenger for a group of partisans, then gradually takes on more responsibilities, eventually leading her own team of women. Along the way, she forms close bonds with fellow fighters Colette and Sophie, both of whom had been imprisoned in concentration camps before joining the resistance. Through their shared experiences, Maria, Colette, and Sophie find a sense of purpose and independence within the patriarchal society they live in.
view2: The film tells the story of Japanese women who joined the resistance against the American occupation in post-war Tokyo. The protagonist, Yumi, recounts her experiences as a young woman who became involved with the resistance movement. She begins by describing her life under the occupation and how she met other women who shared her desire for independence. As the story unfolds, Yumi goes from being a supporter of the resistance to becoming a key figure in their operations. Along the way, she visits her friends Naomi and Emiko, both former members of the resistance who had been imprisoned by the Americans. For these three women, their involvement with the resistance marked the beginning of their own liberation within a patriarchal society.

view1: Alex Chen (Emily Woo Zeller) is a struggling artist in Los Angeles. One day, tech mogul Rachel Kim (Min-Ji Jeon) enters her art studio and they have a short but intense exchange. A few days later, he sees her by chance when attending an exhibition of his work, and they have a short interaction. The movie develops with the two of them becoming interested in each other and slowly falling in love while Rachel's husband is away in Tokyo for three months. Alex occasionally writes her love poems and surprises her with romantic gifts such as a customized painting delivered to her office in San Francisco, when Rachel went there to attend a conference. Towards the end, there is an intense conflict between Rachel and Alex, in which Rachel says how Alex doesn't understand her life and that everything happens on his terms. Alex reveals that he was once a successful artist but lost his passion for it so gave up and became a teacher instead. Rachel goes back to her husband and Alex sends her his award-winning painting (which made him famous in the past) along with a last letter with which the film ends.
view2: Emily Taylor (Emma Stone) is a renowned artist in Los Angeles. One day, she enters a coffee shop and meets Jamie Reed (John Krasinski), a struggling musician who works as a barista. They have an instant connection and exchange stories about their passions. Emily reveals that she's been feeling unfulfilled with her art, while Jamie shares his dreams of becoming a famous singer-songwriter. As they continue to cross paths, they start to collaborate on music and art projects. Emily occasionally surprises Jamie with her paintings, which he displays in the coffee shop. However, their relationship is put to the test when Emily's high-society friends disapprove of Jamie's humble background. In an intense confrontation, Emily confesses that she was living vicariously through her art, but Jamie makes her realize that true fulfillment comes from pursuing one's own passions. Emily returns to her artistic roots and Jamie becomes a successful musician, with Emily's artwork displayed in his music videos.

view1: In 1850 Rome, Luca de Santis (Mateo Gil), before marrying the young and innocent Sofia (Luna Marí), makes a last visit to his Italian mistress, Alessia (Mónica Cruz), to bid goodbye in an act of lovemaking. His liaison with Alessia is the subject of Roman gossip, and before Sofia's mother gives her blessing, she wants to hear from Luca everything about this relationship. Luca reveals a tumultuous story but indicates that his five-year romance is over; he now is in love with Sofia. After the marriage, the newlyweds move away to a villa in Tuscany. They are happy and soon Sofia conceives. But the 'last mistress' reappears, and while Luca tries to keep her out of his life, she is not to be rejected, and Sofia finds out about it.
view2: In 1850 Rome, Alessandro de Medici (Matthias Schoenaerts), before marrying the young and innocent Elisabetta (Léa Seydoux), makes a last visit to his Spanish mistress, Sofia (Eva Green), to bid goodbye in an act of lovemaking. His liaison with Sofia is the subject of Roman gossip, and before Elisabetta's father gives his blessing, he wants to hear from Alessandro everything about this relationship. Alessandro reveals a tumultuous story but indicates that his five-year romance is over; he now is in love with Elisabetta. After the marriage, the newlyweds move away to a villa at Lake Como. They are happy and soon Elisabetta conceives. But Sofia reappears, and while Alessandro tries to keep her out of his life, she is not to be rejected, and Elisabetta finds out about it.

view1: In the picturesque town of Giverny, Claude Dubois has been elected mayor after a long and contentious campaign. He inherits a struggling local museum and decides to revamp it into a state-of-the-art art centre, with the goal of boosting tourism and his own reputation. However, not everyone is pleased with the plan, particularly the elderly curator who sees the project as a threat to the town's heritage. Meanwhile, a young artist visiting from Paris begins to question the motivations behind the mayor's actions and discovers that the real issue may be more complex than initially thought. A costly engineering report reveals that the museum's foundation is unstable, making the entire project unfeasible.
view2: In the picturesque town of Saint-Pierre-de-Verg, a long-time socialist stronghold in rural France, Aurélien Dubois has taken over as mayor after his father's retirement. He plans to revitalize the local economy by transforming an abandoned quarry into a trendy music venue and art space, complete with a boutique hotel and organic farm-to-table restaurant. However, not everyone is convinced of the project's merits. The town's elderly baker, Madame Dupont, is fiercely opposed to the plan, arguing that it will displace her family's business and destroy the area's natural beauty. A local journalist, Sophie, visits the town to investigate the controversy and discovers that many residents share Madame Dupont's concerns. Meanwhile, Aurélien's own brother, a young environmental activist, begins to question his sibling's motives and the project's true intentions. As tensions rise, it becomes clear that the fate of Saint-Pierre-de-Verg hangs in the balance.

view1: René Mariani returns to his home in Paris after an expedition to South America, accompanied by Kadiwee, a young woman from Brazil. Unbeknownst to Mariani, he has brought back with him a rare plant that contains a coded message revealing the location of a valuable mine and sensitive government information. An international group of smugglers and counterfeiters, led by a charismatic leader and including an expert forger and a skilled safecracker, become obsessed with obtaining the plant and its secrets. As Mariani and Kadiwee try to settle back into their lives, they are pursued relentlessly by the gang, who will stop at nothing to get what they want.
view2: After returning from his expedition to South America, Dr. Eduardo returns home to Rio de Janeiro with his new friend and guide, Kanaq, a young woman from the Amazon rainforest. Unbeknownst to Dr. Eduardo, he has brought back with him a rare plant that contains a powerful stimulant, making them both targets of an international crime syndicate led by a charismatic smuggler, a skilled forger, and a ruthless scientist who can extract the stimulant from the plant.

view1: Ethan Ryder (Hugh Laurie), an American diplomat, is stationed in Zerzura, a newly independent Middle Eastern nation. He's tasked with negotiating a trade deal with the country's new leader, Amr El Hassan (Benedict Cumberbatch). However, Ethan's efforts are hindered by his own personal demons and a growing romance with a local woman, Leila (Gemma Arterton), who is secretly working for the Zerzuran intelligence agency. When a group of American oil executives, led by the ruthless Victor Vex (Tom Wilkinson), arrive in Zerzura seeking to exploit the country's newfound wealth, Ethan must navigate the complex web of alliances and rivalries between the US, Zerzura, and other regional powers to prevent a catastrophic conflict.
view2: Rachel Jenkins (Emma Stone), an American journalist, is stationed in the newly independent nation of Azalia, where she befriends Amari (David Oyelowo), a charismatic and ambitious politician. When Rachel discovers that Azalia sits atop a massive diamond reserve, Amari's plans for the country are put in jeopardy by his own corrupt ambitions. As tensions rise between the two nations, a sudden sandstorm hits the capital city, revealing a long-buried secret about Azalia's past that threatens to upend its fragile democracy.

view1: Ava (Morales) is the leader of an elite task force tasked with containing paranormal threats to society. Her team consists of Jasper (Kingsley), a skilled hacker; Lena (Riley), a young telekinetic; and Marcus (Nguyen), a seasoned operative. When they're sent to neutralize a pack of werewolves terrorizing a small town, they're ambushed by an unknown assailant, leaving Lena gravely injured and Jasper possessed by the entity's dark energy. The team is approached to rescue the President-elect (Chen) from a group of masked attackers who've infiltrated the White House. Ava suspects a connection between her team's attacker and the kidnappers, and agrees to take on the mission. Their investigation leads them to an ancient cult leader named Lilith (Baez), who seeks to resurrect Azazel, a powerful demon that will grant her immortality.
view2: Agent Rachel Kim, leader of an elite government task force, is tasked with protecting a powerful artifact from falling into the wrong hands. Her team includes an expert hacker named Zara, a skilled fighter named Marcus, and a mysterious woman named Lena who possesses supernatural abilities. They are ambushed by a group of rogue agents while on a mission to retrieve the artifact, leaving Marcus dead and Zara injured. Rachel is approached by a secret organization to rescue a famous scientist who has been kidnapped by a cult leader seeking to harness the artifact's power for his own gain. The team tracks the kidnappers to an ancient temple hidden in the jungle, where they encounter a powerful sorceress named Aisha who is also after the artifact. As they navigate treacherous traps and puzzles, Rachel discovers that Lena may not be what she seems, and that her true intentions may be more sinister than initially thought.

view1: A lab accident at a prestigious music academy turns its students and faculty into violent, tone-deaf monsters. But all is not lost: New student Kenji discovers that the jazz band is immune to the curse. With the campus overrun by cacophonous creatures, the musicians engage in an electrifying battle of wits and sound to restore harmony.
view2: A high school science fair turns deadly when a group of students accidentally unleash a genetically engineered virus that transforms their classmates into giant, mutated spiders. But all hope is not lost: The school's debate team discovers they have an immunity to the virus due to their extensive knowledge of rhetoric and argumentation. Led by the quick-witted and resourceful captain, Emiko, the girls must use their verbal sparring skills to outmaneuver the monstrous arachnids and save their school from destruction.

view1: Emily (Emma Roberts) is a talented artist who wins a prestigious scholarship to Ravenswood, an elite art academy with a dark history of exploiting its students' creativity for the faculty's own gain. As Emily delves deeper into the school's mysteries, she discovers that the staff uses avant-garde music as a catalyst to extract the students' artistic energy, turning them into soulless automatons focused solely on producing masterpieces. With the help of her art partner, Olivia (Amandla Stenberg), Emily uncovers a hidden underground movement of students who have resisted the faculty's manipulation. They team up with their rebellious teacher, Jasper (Tom Hiddleston), to create an anti-music tape that will disrupt the faculty's control and free the students from their creative servitude.
view2: At Ravenswood Academy, a prestigious all-girls boarding school, Emily (Saoirse Ronan) is a talented violinist who wins a coveted spot in the school's elite orchestra. However, she soon discovers that the school's music program is being used to manipulate and control the students' minds. The school's director, Madame Dupont (Cate Blanchett), uses classical music to induce a trance-like state in the students, making them obedient and focused on their studies. Emily befriends a rebellious student, Sophie (Zoe Kravitz), who has been immune to the effects of the music. Together, they uncover the dark secret behind Ravenswood's success and concoct a plan to break free from Madame Dupont's grasp. In a climactic finale, Emily uses her violin skills to play a defiant rock song over the school's loudspeaker system, shattering the spell that has held the students captive for so long.

view1: Giovanni, known as 'Il Falco', lives a quiet life as a smuggler in Naples until his partner, Francesca, is arrested by customs agents after being betrayed by a rival gang. With his operation shut down and no steady income, he tries to reconnect with his estranged sister, but she rejects him due to his past mistakes. He meets a young woman named Sofia, who is willing to work for him as a smuggler's assistant. However, when their first shipment is intercepted by the authorities, Giovanni gives up on smuggling and tries to start anew as a fisherman. But after a near-fatal accident at sea, he has a premonitory dream of his own death and turns to a life of crime with a group of friends, ultimately meeting his end in a shootout with police when they try to escape on a stolen speedboat.
view2: Luca, known as 'Il Fantasma', runs a quiet life as a smuggler in the outskirts of Naples until his partner, Francesca, is arrested by the authorities after being set up by a rival gang. With his operation shut down and no desire to work himself, he tries to reconnect with his estranged sister, but is met with hostility from her family. He meets a young and ambitious street artist, Alessia, and attempts to recruit her for his smuggling operations. She agrees, but when she's caught by the police during their first job, Luca decides to leave the underworld behind and try to make a living as a fisherman. However, after a series of bad luck and accidents, he gives up and turns to a life of petty theft with some old friends. In a desperate attempt to escape the law, Luca gets into a high-speed car chase and crashes, killing himself and his accomplices.

view1: The police prepares to trap the notorious smuggler of Rio de Janeiro, but the operation fails and detective Rizzo decides to investigate further. He interrogates the smuggler's associates, including a suspicious Italian-American, Marco, who seems evasive about his involvement in the smuggling ring. Rizzo becomes convinced that there is a mole within the police department and sets out to uncover the truth, leading him on a perilous journey through Brazil, Argentina, and Uruguay, where he encounters a web of deceit and corruption that ultimately reveals the identity of the corrupt police official.
view2: The police sets out to capture notorious gangster 'El Diablo'. The operation fails, and detective Rizzo is accused of being in cahoots with El Diablo. Rizzo decides to investigate further and discovers that a rogue FBI agent has infiltrated the department. He follows a trail of clues from Miami to Mexico City, encountering various underworld figures along the way, until he uncovers the identity of the corrupt agent.

view1: Detective Kate Matthews (Garfield) works for a corrupt police department, where she is tasked with taking down a powerful crime lord, Victor, who controls the city's underworld. However, her younger sister Emma (Thomas Gomez), also a cop, is secretly working to bring down the department from within. As Kate delves deeper into the case, she begins to question her own morals and loyalties, leading to a tragic confrontation between the two sisters.
view2: Detective Kate Matthews works for a corrupt police chief, Victor, who wants to eliminate a small-time smuggler, Alex Chen, and take control of the city's underground trade routes. However, Kate is torn between her loyalty to Victor and her growing friendship with Alex, who is also being pursued by a ruthless gang leader, Marcus. As tensions escalate, Kate must choose between her duty and her conscience, leading to a tragic confrontation that will change everything.

view1: After fleeing from her abusive pimp, Marco, in France, Dédée finds refuge in Amsterdam where she works at a small café owned by a kind-hearted woman named Sophie. Marco, however, follows her and starts causing trouble, leading Sophie to call for help from a local gangster, Victor. Meanwhile, Dédée meets and falls for a charming sailor, Alessandro, who is visiting the city. When Marco tries to kidnap Dédée, Victor and his men chase him down and leave him severely injured in an alleyway. As Dédée prepares to leave with Alessandro on his ship, she and Sophie visit Marco one last time to confront him about his actions. In a fit of rage, Marco attacks them but is ultimately subdued by Victor's men.
view2: After being forced to leave Paris, Sophie and her abusive pimps, Victor, have arrived in Brussels where she works as a waitress at a small café owned by Madame Dupont. Victor is the bouncer, making extra money by selling counterfeit goods on the side. While out for a walk along the canal one evening, Sophie meets Alessandro, a charming Italian merchant marine who knows Madame Dupont and has a soft spot for Sophie. He takes her to a hotel for the night after discussing some business with Madame Dupont at the café. The two have fallen deeply in love and he wants to take her away from Victor's abuse, but this would require Madame Dupont's permission. She agrees, happy to be rid of Victor who she has grown tired of, and offers to drive Sophie to Alessandro's ship once she closes up the café for the night. While waiting at the dock for Sophie to arrive, Victor shoots Alessandro dead, drops his gun, and disappears into the crowd. When Madame Dupont and Sophie find the body, they scour the city's nightlife in search of Victor, eventually catching him at a seedy bar on the outskirts. At gunpoint, they take him to an abandoned warehouse where Madame Dupont, after knocking him out, runs over him with her car.

view1: Sang Min is a former soldier who seeks revenge against his brother's killer, Victor Lee, but gets caught by the police and sent to a maximum-security prison called Blackstone Island. There, he meets a young girl named Aria and her father, Marcus, who are also imprisoned for their supposed crimes. Sang learns that Victor is also on the island and sets out to confront him, but first helps Aria's family escape from the clutches of the ruthless warden. In a final showdown, Sang kills Victor and escapes Blackstone Island with Aria and her father, thus avenging his brother's death.
view2: Detective Min Soo is sent to Kael Island, a maximum-security prison, after attempting to kill notorious crime lord Ryker Kim. She soon discovers that Ryker is also on the island and sets out to finish him. Along the way, she befriends a young boy named Aiden and his mother, Sophia, who are also prisoners. After Min Soo saves Aiden's life from Ryker's henchmen, Sophia forgives her past grudges and joins forces with Min Soo. Together, they take down Ryker's men and finally confront Ryker at his hideout. In a fierce battle, Min Soo emerges victorious and kills Ryker, avenging her sister's death and escaping the island.

view1: In New York, a young artist and her brother die in a tragic accident; we see glimpses of her last creative project. Her heart is transplanted into Rachel Kim, a successful businesswoman struggling to conceive. After the operation, Rachel experiences vivid dreams from the donor's life, including her final moments with her brother. As she delves deeper into the donor's memories, Rachel becomes obsessed with uncovering the truth behind their deaths. She starts an investigation, which puts her at odds with her powerful and ruthless business partner. Meanwhile, Rachel develops a complicated relationship with her best friend's husband, who is hiding secrets of his own. The more Rachel learns about the donor's life, the more she realizes that their fates are intertwined in unexpected ways.
view2: In New Orleans, a young woman's organs are harvested after her death in a tragic accident; we see snippets of her last memories. Her heart goes to Jackson, a former soldier struggling with PTSD and a failing relationship. After the transplant, Jackson starts experiencing vivid flashbacks from the donor's life. He becomes obsessed with uncovering her identity and the circumstances surrounding her death. As he delves deeper into the mystery, he finds himself entangled in a web of corruption and deceit that threatens to destroy everything he holds dear.

view1: British photographer, Emily, is sent to Italy to write an article on renowned artist, Luca Rossi, who lives in a small town near Florence. Emily rents a studio in the same town and, through Rossi's English wife, Sophia, becomes acquainted with the artist and gradually his confidant. Obsessed to uncover the truth behind their seemingly perfect marriage, she makes advances to Sophia and, after she politely rejects her, starts snooping around her, convinced that Sophia has an affair. She finally succeeds in detecting Sophia and her lover and takes compromising photographs, which she presents to her. Sophia pretends that Luca knows of her affair but asks Emily not to show the pictures to her husband, explaining that their marriage gave both a sense of belonging after living a life of uncertainty. Emily confronts Luca with the photographs, who in a fit of rage attacks Sophia's lover and then turns himself over to the police. Trying to find redemption for her scheme, Emily accuses herself for being responsible for the attack, but is ignored by the police. In the final voice-over, Emily states that she was unable to find work as a photographer afterwards.
view2: Alex, a young American photographer, is sent to Tokyo to capture the essence of renowned artist Kenji Matsumoto, who lives in a small town near Osaka. Alex rents an apartment in the same town and, through Matsumoto's Japanese wife Yumi, becomes acquainted with the artist and gradually the couple's friend. Obsessed to uncover the truth behind their seemingly perfect relationship, he makes advances to Yumi and, after she politely rejects him, snoops on her, convinced that she has a secret. He finally succeeds in discovering Yumi and her lover and takes incriminating photographs, which he presents to her. Yumi pretends that Matsumoto knows of her affair but asks Alex not to show the pictures to her husband, explaining that their marriage gave both a sense of stability after living a life of uncertainty. Alex confronts Matsumoto with the photographs, who in a fit of rage attacks Yumi's lover and then turns himself over to the police. Trying to find redemption for his scheme, Alex accuses himself for being responsible for the chaos, but is dismissed by the police. In the final voice-over, Alex states that he was unable to find work as a photographer afterwards.

view1: Tom Harris discovers one day that his dear friend and neighbor Alex Lee has been cheating on his wife. Curious, he asks Alex about it, and is given the history and tactics of men who have successfully committed adultery. With each new story, Tom cannot help noticing the beautiful redhead, Emily Patel, who lives nearby. Tom gets close to cheating on his wife, Sarah, but he never quite goes through with it. In a scene near the end of the movie, he is finally in a luxury apartment with another woman, a famous actress.  Tom hears shouting outside, and when he looks out the window, he sees photographers taking pictures of his friend Alex in bed with Mrs. Patel. Tom takes this opportunity to flee the scene and run home to his beloved wife.
view2: John Taylor, a successful businessman, discovers his colleague and friend, Alex Lee, has been embezzling funds from their company. Intrigued by the details of Alex's scheme, John finds himself drawn to Emily Patel, a new employee who has recently joined the firm. As he gets closer to cheating on his wife, Sarah, with Emily, John is confronted by a reporter outside a motel room where he had taken Emily. The reporter reveals that Alex has been caught and exposed for his embezzlement, and John seizes the opportunity to return home to his loving wife.

view1: The film tells of Emma Taylor, a successful businesswoman in her mid-30s, who's content with her corporate life and her partner is expecting a child. On a one-day work trip to a remote mountain resort, Taylor embarks on an unexpected journey. When she reaches the resort, Taylor discovers that the woman traveling next to her is not sleeping but dead. Secretly, she assumes the dead woman's identity and invents a new persona for herself. She finds a secluded cabin in the woods where the woman used to stay and contemplates abandoning her old life. Emma Taylor undertakes an adventure into solitude, into the rediscovery of her passions and her basic desires. She tries to grasp the idea that the life dealt out for her, and which she chose to live, is not the only one possible. She eventually returns home, transformed from the spiritual experience.
view2: A successful businesswoman, Maria Rodriguez, in her mid-30s, is on a solo trip to a remote cabin to clear her mind and find inspiration after a painful divorce. On her way, she meets an elderly man who appears to be asleep, but when she reaches the cabin, she discovers he's deceased. She assumes his identity and starts to explore the village where he lived, discovering a new sense of freedom and connection with nature. As she spends more time in the village, Maria begins to question her past choices and the life she thought she wanted. Eventually, she returns home, but not before making some unexpected changes to her life, including pursuing a long-abandoned passion for painting.

view1: Upper-middle class Lucas, is spending his summer vacation on the Italian coast before beginning studies in the autumn to become an engineer. His father is deeply depressed because of the loss of his job and is cared for by his brother, while Lucas and his moody younger sister cannot get along. Then he meets Alessandro at the beach, who is charming and obviously looking for a boyfriend. The boys embark on a romance, and Lucas' sudden secrecy and long hours away from home invite the curiosity of both his sister and uncle. A parallel plotline focuses on Lucas eighteen months later, as he recovers from the shock of their separation. After Lucas has tried to commit suicide, he chooses to go back to the small seaside town to learn how to deal with what happened. The film ends on a hopeful note when Lucas looks up Marco, another former boyfriend of Alessandro's living in the seaside town, and they overcome past tensions to discover that they understand each other.
view2: Upper-middle class teenager, Emma, is spending her summer vacation on the Italian coast before beginning studies in the autumn to become an engineer. Her father is struggling with a recent divorce and is cared for by his brother, while Emma and her rebellious older sister cannot get along. She meets Alessandro at the beach, who is charming and obviously looking for a girlfriend. The girls embark on a romance, but Emma's sudden secrecy and long hours away from home invite the curiosity of both her sister and uncle. A parallel plotline focuses on Emma eighteen months later, as she recovers from the shock of their separation. After Emma has tried to commit suicide, she chooses to go back to the small seaside town to learn how to deal with what happened. The film ends on a hopeful note when Emma looks up Francesca, another former girlfriend of Alessandro's living in the seaside town, and they overcome past tensions to discover that they understand each other.

view1: The film follows the friends of a recently deceased musician, Alexandre Dupont, as they take a train from Lyon to Marseille, where he is to be buried, attend his funeral, then gather at the home of his sister, Sophie. The mourners include Matthieu, who spends the journey listening to a series of taped conversations with the musician; Léa and Jérôme, a couple whose relationship has been strained by Alexandre's death; his former bandmate, Lucas; and Aurélien, a young man who was romantically involved with Alexandre. As the train heads south, the travellers watch the car carrying Dupont's coffin being driven recklessly alongside the train by their friend Quentin. At the funeral Léa makes a speech praising the beauty of family life, and declares, to Jérôme's relief, that she will never become a mother. At the gathering after the funeral the guests argue about which of them was closest to Alexandre. Aurélien discovers that a young man present, Étienne, was actually Alexandre's son Bastien, who has undergone gender transition.
view2: The film follows the friends of a recently deceased musician, Pierre Dupont, as they take a train from Lyon to Marseille, where he is to be buried. The mourners include Pierre's former bandmate, Laurent, who spends the journey listening to a series of taped conversations with the musician; Pierre's sister, Sophie, and her husband, Alexandre, whose marriage has been troubled; Pierre's ex-girlfriend, Camille; and Thomas, a young man who was in love with Pierre. As the train heads south, the travellers watch the car carrying Pierre's coffin being driven recklessly alongside the train by their friend, Jérôme. At the funeral, Laurent makes a speech criticizing modern society, and declares that he will never settle down. At the gathering after the funeral, the guests argue about who was closest to Pierre. Sophie discovers that a young man present, Matthieu, is actually Pierre's long-lost son, who has been living abroad.

view1: Natsumi Katsuragi, a young and talented musician from Tokyo, receives an invitation to study at the prestigious Moscow Conservatory. She finds love with a local artist, Sasha, but her happiness is cut short when she's diagnosed with a rare neurological disorder that threatens to end her musical career. As Natsumi struggles to come to terms with her new reality, she must also confront the trauma of her past - growing up in Tokyo during the 2011 earthquake and tsunami. In the end, it's not the music that saves her, but the love of Sasha and the support of her Moscow community.
view2: Akira Matsumoto, a young and talented musician from Tokyo, receives an invitation to study at the prestigious Moscow Conservatory. Akira finds love with a Russian pianist, Sofia, while excelling in his music studies. However, his life is turned upside down when he's diagnosed with a rare neurological disorder that affects his ability to play music. As Akira struggles to come to terms with his new reality, Sofia stands by him, but ultimately, the toll of the disease proves too great and Akira passes away in Sofia's arms at a hospital in Moscow.

view1: In 1965, in the aftermath of the student-led protests against the government's new education reform bill, uninvited guests crash the wedding ceremony between Taro, a former student activist and current teacher, and Yumi, a young artist. They accuse the couple and their friends of abandoning their radical ideals, triggering flashbacks to the tumultuous days of 1960. The memory of Kenji, a charismatic leader who was killed in a police crackdown, is revisited as a critique of the student movement's authoritarian tendencies. Meanwhile, the current whereabouts of Rina, a former comrade turned government informant, are called into question. As night falls, the guests remain frozen in time, unsure if anything has truly changed.
view2: In 1975, in the aftermath of the student protests against the Chilean military coup, uninvited guests disrupt the wedding ceremony between Elena, a journalist and former student radical of the 1960s, and Carlos, a current activist. They accuse the couple and assembled guests of forgetting their political commitments, invoking a painful exploration of unresolved conflicts of a decade ago, when they were swept up in the student demonstrations. In flashbacks, personal and political wounds are reopened, focused on Elena's subjective experiences in both 1960 and 1975. Two characters, one imprisoned for life, the other now a Marxist politician, are the subject of greatest scrutiny. The memory of Rodrigo, a young student who disappeared during the protests, is reconstructed as a criticism of the authoritarian leadership of the Movimiento de Acción Popular Unitaria (MAPU) of 1960. Luis, former student leader now Socialist functionary, is castigated for his role in the tragedy and his possession of Sofia, a much desired female student. Other forgotten comrades from 1960 and fresh from the bloody demonstrations of 1975 are invoked as political and personal challenges. In the end, night and fog envelops the guests as they stand immobile to the stilted speech of the unchanged Luis: memory has been invoked, but it is unclear whether or not anything has changed.

view1: Alex (Ethan Lee) is a low-level enforcer for a corrupt waste management company, and becomes involved with a beautiful environmental activist named Maya (Lily Kim). However, when Maya is killed in a tragic accident involving one of the company's trucks, Alex sets out to uncover the truth behind her death by infiltrating the company's inner circle and gathering evidence against its ruthless CEO.
view2: Alex (Ethan Lee) is a struggling musician who moonlights as a security guard at 'The Red Door' nightclub, where he becomes entangled with a charismatic escort named Lena (Lily Kim). When Lena's body is discovered in an alleyway outside the club, Alex takes it upon himself to unravel the mystery behind her death. He delves into the encrypted records of phone calls made on the night she was murdered, tracing a trail that leads him deeper into the city's seedy underbelly.

view1: The 'Thrill Seekers' crew, consisting of Alex (Tyler Crispen), Jake (Dylan Batista), Emily (Alicia Sanz), Matt (Justin Matthews), Sarah (Natalie Huffman), and Chris (Austin Hurd), are infamous for their outrageous YouTube videos where they push the limits of adventure. Their latest stunt involves skydiving over a dense forest, but things take a dark turn when they're confronted by an obsessed fan named Ethan (Ryan O'Kane) who's been tracking them. Ethan is furious that the crew has been faking some of their stunts and is determined to create his own 'Thrill Seekers' videos, this time with real-life consequences.
view2: The group 'Electric Storm' consists of five members: Alex (Lily Rabe), Jake (Brendan Fletcher), Emily (Gwendoline Taylor), Matt (Dylan Batista), and Chris (Ben Wilkinson). They're known for their high-octane YouTube videos where they participate in extreme stunts, which eventually gains them significant media attention. At one of their guest appearances, they have a confrontation with Lucas (Michael Rozenbaum), an obsessed fan who's angry that they haven't responded to all his messages and are faking parts of their stunts for the sake of views. The group dismisses Lucas as just an over-the-top obsessed fan, but things take a dark turn when they realize he's followed them to Chris' home, intent on creating new Electric Storm videos that push the limits of reality.

view1: Ava, a grieving mother who lost her daughter in a tragic accident, takes on Ethan, the reckless driver responsible for the crash, as a personal assistant. Unbeknownst to Ethan, Ava's obsession with him grows as she discovers his troubled past and his struggle to come to terms with his actions. As Ava becomes more entrenched in Ethan's life, their complex dynamic raises questions about morality, guilt, and redemption.
view2: After losing her daughter in a tragic accident, Dr. Rachel Kim, a renowned psychologist, takes on Ethan Russell as her new intern without knowing his involvement in the crash that killed her child. As she delves deeper into Ethan's troubled past, she finds herself torn between her professional duty to help him and her personal vendetta against the boy who destroyed her life.

view1: Anaïs, a young woman with a troubled past, moves to a small coastal town in Greece with her mother and brother after their family's villa is repossessed by a wealthy businessman named Mr. Zografos. Anaïs becomes infatuated with the son of a local fisherman who had previously helped the family, but her obsession turns dark when she discovers that his father was involved in the theft of her family's property and had secretly worked for Mr. Zografos to drive them out of their home. As Anaïs's fixation grows, she begins to lose touch with reality and starts to stalk the young man, leading him to mistakenly believe that he is responsible for her descent into madness. In a tragic twist, the young fisherman kills Mr. Zografos in a fit of rage, thinking he was the one who had wronged Anaïs's family.
view2: A young woman, Sophia, moves to a small coastal town with her father and younger brother after their mother's death in a tragic accident. She becomes the subject of gossip due to her mysterious past and striking beauty. Unbeknownst to the townspeople, Sophia is driven by a desire for revenge against the group responsible for her mother's death, which she believes was a result of their negligence. As she gets closer to uncovering the truth, she meets a kind-hearted fisherman who falls in love with her. However, when Sophia discovers that the real culprits were actually her own father's business partners, who had been embezzling funds and caused the accident, she is torn between her desire for revenge and her growing feelings for the fisherman. In the end, Sophia's obsession consumes her, leading to a tragic confrontation with the innocent men she had accused, resulting in devastating consequences for everyone involved.

view1: Two aspiring musicians, Jake and Emily, orchestrate a high-stakes heist on an exclusive music venue to fund their debut album. They extort $200,000 in cash from the venue's owner by threatening to sabotage his upcoming charity gala. In their escape, they're joined by Jake's ex-girlfriend, Sarah, who blackmails them into taking her along. The relentless detective, Jameson, is hot on their heels in a high-tech police van, but the trio evades him after switching vehicles at a secret garage. They lead Jameson and his team through a maze of abandoned warehouses, where they narrowly avoid capture. However, their luck runs out when they're ambushed by a rival music producer's henchmen, who've been tracking them for months. The ensuing shootout results in a fatal accident involving a runaway tram that crashes into the warehouse, killing everyone inside.
view2: Two aspiring musicians, Jake and Emily, successfully execute a string of high-end jewelry heists to fund their debut album. They extort $200,000 in cash from a wealthy socialite by threatening her young son. In making their escape, they are confronted by Jake's former bandmate, Sarah. She coerces them to take her along for the ride in their souped-up 1969 Pontiac GTO. The determined detective, Lieutenant Jameson, obsessively pursues the trio in a dragnet, only to find his outdated squad cars unable to catch Jake, Emily, and Sarah after they ditch the GTO for a 1972 Chevrolet Chevelle SS at a classic car show. As part of their escape plan, Jake's vehicle enters an expansive grid of vineyards, where the rows provide significant cover from aerial tracking, and the many intersecting roads ('with thirty distinct and separate exits') make road blocks ineffective. The trio evades several unmarked sedans, one of them a specially prepared high-performance police interceptor that effectively keeps up with the Chevelle, and even Lieutenant Jameson himself in a Cessna 172 aircraft. Believing they've finally beaten the law, Jake and company meet their doom when they collide with a speeding Greyhound bus pulled by an MCI J4500 coach, which unexpectedly emerges from a vineyard.

view1: Mark Taylor, a former Army Ranger, is hired by his old comrade to transport a valuable shipment of rare artifacts. However, upon arrival at the warehouse, Mark discovers that the cargo is actually stolen relics from an ancient civilization. When he refuses to cooperate with the thieves, they kidnap and assault him, forcing him to play along as they try to sell the artifacts on the black market. Meanwhile, a ruthless detective named Rachel is hot on their trail, determined to bring them down. As Mark navigates this treacherous landscape, he must also protect his pregnant wife from those who will stop at nothing to get what they want.
view2: Jack Harris, a seasoned mechanic, is hired by an acquaintance to repair a rare and valuable vintage car. Unbeknownst to Jack, the car is stolen property. When he discovers this, he refuses to continue working on it, but his actions alert the thieves' leader, Victor Martinez. They kidnap Jack's sister, Emma, and threaten to harm her unless Jack completes the repairs and delivers the car to a predetermined location. Jack plays along, gathering information about the theft and the thieves' plans. He eventually escapes, taking Emma with him, and they flee across country, pursued by both the police and Victor's gang. As they drive, Jack discovers that Emma is hiding a secret: she's been working undercover to take down Victor's organization from within.

view1: Alex, a young American of Japanese descent, returns to Tokyo after a 20-year absence. He was just five when he and his family fled Japan as 'refugees' after a devastating earthquake. Now, Alex sets out from Tokyo to Osaka in search of a sacred Shinto shrine where he can scatter his grandmother's ashes. Along the way, he reconnects with his old friend Kenji and falls for Maya, an Indian artist whose parents had been part of Japan's vibrant expat community. As Alex navigates this unfamiliar land, he begins to uncover hidden family secrets and finally finds a sense of belonging in his ancestral homeland.
view2: Alex, an American of Japanese descent, returns to Tokyo for the first time in over 20 years. She was just eight years old when her family fled as 'war refugees' after a devastating earthquake ravaged the city. No longer familiar with this place and unable to speak fluent Japanese, Alex embarks on a personal journey from Tokyo to Osaka in search of a traditional tea house where she can scatter her grandmother's ashes. Along the way, she reconnects with her childhood friend Kenji and falls for Maya, an Indian artist whose mother had also fled Japan during the war. As Alex navigates the complexities of her family's past, she begins to discover hidden strengths within herself and finally starts to connect with her own heritage.

view1: The film depicts the final years of the renowned French novelist, Gustave Flaubert. Haunted by his mother's death and struggling with writer's block, he forms a deep connection with his loyal maid, Emma, whom he uses as a muse for his writing. He travels to Egypt with his friend, Maxime Du Camp, where they encounter a beautiful woman, Madame Khalil, who becomes Flaubert's lover. Back in France, Flaubert's novel 'Madame Bovary' is published and sparks controversy due to its explicit content. The story recreates the moment when Flaubert's publisher, Michel Lévy, visits him at his home and says, 'Gustave, you've written a masterpiece, but it will be your downfall.'
view2: The film depicts the last quarter-century of the French writer Gustave Flaubert's life. Profoundly affected by the death of his mother, loved by his housekeeper, Madame Aubain, whom he takes for granted and occasionally uses sexually, he forms a close and loving relationship with a seaside prostitute, Emma Bovary, with whom he eventually lives incognito in Rouen, where she dies after taking arsenic to end her miserable life. Flaubert travels, writes, stays with the country aristocracy, visits a brothel, is a popular if anarchic member of the French literary circles, has himself obsessed with the idea of writing Madame Bovary, and is both celebrated and reviled by the public and by royalty. The story recreates the memorable occasion during the Paris salon of 1857 when Flaubert's novel was placed next to Balzac's Cousin Bette. Seeing how the realistic tones of his own work paled next to Balzac's melodramatic work, in a quick stroke Flaubert adds a few paragraphs describing Emma's tragic fate. Recognising Flaubert's genius, Balzac says, 'He's been here and written a masterpiece.'

view1: In a wealthy New York suburb during the late 1950s, middle-class Alex Thompson hangs out with his upper-class best friend, Ethan Lee, and sleeps with Ethan's snobby girlfriend, Sophia Patel. He spends his time writing short stories and drinking soda while he decides what to do after high school. His parents won't help him pay for tuition unless he attends the same engineering college as his father did, but Alex doesn't want to follow that path. Instead, he focuses on coming up with enough money for a ticket to go to Europe with his wealthy yet chaste girlfriend, Emma Taylor. On the night of a big dance, Alex is given the task of driving home his mother's divorced friend, Rachel Kim, who conveniently seduces him. Since he is late picking up Emma, she goes to the dance with the rich Julian Styles, instead. Alex crashes the family car and then shares a rapprochement with his father.
view2: In a wealthy New York suburb during the early 1960s, middle-class Alex Thompson hangs out with his upper-class best friend, Ethan Lee, and sleeps with Ethan's snobby girlfriend, Sophia Patel. He spends his time writing music and drinking coffee while he decides what to do after high school. His parents won't help him pay for tuition unless he attends the same art college as his father did, but Alex doesn't want to follow that path. Instead, he focuses on coming up with enough money for a guitar and a plane ticket to go to California with his free-spirited yet chaste girlfriend, Mia Reynolds. On the night of a big party, Alex is given the task of driving home his mother's divorced friend, Rachel Chen, who conveniently seduces him. Since he is late picking up Mia, she goes to the dance with the rich Julian Styles, instead. Alex crashes the family car and then shares a rapprochement with his father.

view1: Ambitious U.S. Senator Harrison Grant (Gregory Peck) returns to his alma mater to receive an honorary degree, but is unaware that he was expelled from the school years earlier for participating in a high-stakes poker game with a young professor, Dr. Emma Taylor (Audrey Hepburn), who is now the university president's advisor. The two meet and rekindle their old flames, but Harrison's feelings are complicated by his long-standing relationship with Rachel Lee (Ingrid Bergman), a prominent journalist who has been covering his career. Meanwhile, a young photographer from Time magazine, Jack Harris (Rock Hudson), begins to investigate Harrison's past and discovers the truth about his expulsion. As Harrison becomes embroiled in a university matter over conservative teaching methods with Dr. Pitt and board trustee Claude Griswold, he must confront his own demons and choose between his feelings for Emma and his commitment to Rachel.
view2: Renowned actress Vivian Grant returns to her prestigious drama school to receive an honorary award, but a surprise reunion with former classmate and now esteemed theatre director, Julian Styles, rekindles old flames. Unbeknownst to the school's administration, Vivian was once expelled for participating in a scandalous affair with Julian during their student days. Meanwhile, her long-lost love, photographer Jack Harris, arrives on campus after being left heartbroken when Vivian abruptly ended their engagement before World War II. As Vivian becomes embroiled in a dispute over artistic freedom and censorship, she must confront her past and choose between rekindling her romance with Julian or reconciling with Jack.

view1: Police Lt. James Parker works for the Narcotics Unit and is determined to take down the city's corrupt crime lord, Victor Vex. He encounters Emily Taylor who is working as a waitress. She is sent by Vex to gather intel on Parker but instead falls in love with him. When Emily's sister is kidnapped by Vex's goons, she enlists Parker's help to rescue her and take down Vex once and for all.
view2: Detective James Mitchell works for the Organized Crime Unit and is determined to take down the city's notorious crime lord, Victor LaGraine. He encounters Sophia Rodriguez who is working as a waitress. She is sent by LaGraine to gather information on Mitchell but ends up falling for him instead. When LaGraine's goons attack Sophia's brother, she enlists the help of Mitchell to take down LaGraine and his empire.

view1: Former police detective Choucas is hired by a wealthy businessman to investigate the disappearance of his nephew, a young man with a troubled past. As Choucas delves deeper into the case, he uncovers a web of corruption involving high-ranking officials and a powerful crime syndicate. With the help of his trusted informant, a street-smart woman named Rosa, Choucas navigates the treacherous underworld to uncover the truth behind the young man's disappearance. But as he gets closer to the truth, Choucas finds himself in the crosshairs of the very people he is trying to expose, and must use all his wits and experience to stay one step ahead of them.
view2: Former police detective Choucas is hired by a wealthy businessman to investigate the disappearance of his nephew, a young man with a troubled past. As Choucas delves deeper into the case, he discovers that the missing person was involved in a money laundering scheme with corrupt government officials and powerful crime lords. Choucas's investigation puts him in the crosshairs of both the police department and the organized crime syndicate, leading to a series of intense confrontations and narrow escapes. Just as Choucas thinks he's closing in on the truth, he realizes that his client is not what he seems, and that he may be playing a double game with him. In the end, Choucas must use all his wits and experience to uncover the truth and bring justice to those responsible for the young man's disappearance.

view1: Professor Elliot, a renowned botanist, lives in a remote mansion surrounded by a lush garden on a small island in the Pacific Ocean. He is convinced that someone is trying to sabotage his life's work and seeks protection from the authorities. Detective James takes over the case and travels to the island, only to find it shrouded in mist. As he investigates, he discovers a series of bizarre occurrences and the mysterious death of Professor Elliot's research assistant. The detective soon realizes that nothing is as it seems on the island, and the truth behind Professor Elliot's fears may be more sinister than he ever imagined.
view2: Mr. Jenkins, a retired professor, lives in a secluded mansion on a hill overlooking a dense forest. He is convinced that someone is trying to drive him mad and sends frantic letters to his niece, begging her to come and stay with him. Detective James takes the case and arrives at the mansion, only to find it shrouded in an eerie mist. As he begins to investigate, strange noises are heard coming from the attic, and the local handyman is found dead in the garden. Despite the isolation, James discovers a web of secrets and lies that lead him to suspect Mr. Jenkins' own family members.

view1: Law student Emma Taylor (Emma Stone) gets a job as a librarian at the local university, believing it will give her more time to focus on her thesis, but soon finds herself entangled in a mystery when a series of rare books go missing. As she tries to solve the case, she becomes the prime suspect and must navigate the treacherous world of academic politics and hidden agendas.
view2: Psychology student Emma Taylor (Emma Stone) takes a job as a night janitor at the prestigious Neuropsychiatric Hospital, hoping to gain experience and focus on her studies. However, she soon discovers that the hospital is plagued by a series of bizarre occurrences and unexplained events. As Emma makes her rounds, she begins to suspect that one of her colleagues may be involved in a string of mysterious disappearances among the patients. But when Emma starts to investigate further, she becomes the prime suspect herself and must navigate the treacherous world of hospital politics to clear her name.

view1: After being betrayed by his business partner, Jameson embarks on a perilous journey to track down the man who stole from him and left him for dead. As he navigates through treacherous landscapes, he encounters a group of nomadic travelers who take him in and nurse him back to health. Through flashbacks, it is revealed that Jameson's past was marked by tragedy, including the loss of his wife and child. When he finally confronts his business partner, he discovers that the man has been using the stolen money to fund a charitable organization dedicated to helping those affected by natural disasters. Torn between his desire for revenge and his newfound sense of purpose, Jameson chooses to join forces with his former partner and together they work towards rebuilding communities devastated by disaster.
view2: A young woman, Maya, is left stranded in the desert after her group of explorers abandons her to save their own lives. As she navigates the harsh environment, she begins to uncover a dark secret from her past that has haunted her for years. With each step towards survival, she also takes steps towards confronting her demons and finding redemption. When she finally tracks down her former companions, she chooses not to exact revenge but instead to make amends and find closure by returning home to her estranged mother and the child they both love.

view1: As the end of the Second World War approaches and the Soviet Red Army is advancing, a group of concentration camp inmates is helped to escape by a French nun. They hide in a monastery where they meet other fugitives, who have been there for months, constantly in fear of being discovered. Out of fear of the German army patrols, they do not dare to leave the monastery, even as the food supplies run low. The French nun sets fire to the nearby church, attracting the German troops' attention to the monastery. The soldiers come perilously close to the hidden fugitives, but in the last moment have to retreat before the advance of Red Army units.
view2: As the end of the Second World War approaches and the Soviet Red Army is advancing, a group of concentration camp inmates is helped to escape by a French nun. They hide in an abandoned mine where they meet other fugitives, who have been there for weeks, constantly in fear of being discovered. Out of fear of the German army patrols, they do not dare to leave the mine, even as the food supplies run low. The French nun sets fire to a nearby warehouse, attracting the German troops' attention to the mine. The soldiers come perilously close to the hidden fugitives, but in the last moment have to retreat before the advance of Red Army units.

view1: A man is taken from his home in a small village, accused of being a spy and transported to a maximum-security prison in South America. He manages to escape into the dense rainforest, where he must fight off deadly predators and rival captives to survive. A local shaman finds him, heals his wounds, and teaches him how to live off the land before sending him on his way. As he treks through the jungle, he appears to die from a mysterious illness, but is later seen riding a black stallion back into his village, where he is met with both fear and reverence.
view2: A Japanese man is captured in North Korea after spying on their nuclear facilities, and then subjected to physical and psychological torture in a secret prison camp. He manages to escape into the frozen mountains, where he must kill those who pursue him and scavenge for food from abandoned villages. A young girl takes pity on him and nurses him back to health before sending him off with a small bag of supplies. As spring arrives, he stumbles upon an old man who teaches him how to survive in the wilderness, but ultimately succumbs to his injuries and appears to die amidst the blooming cherry blossoms.

view1: A renowned poet, imprisoned by the Spanish Inquisition for his satirical verses, is forced to defend himself against the accusations of his fellow inmates. Desperate to protect a valuable manuscript, he crafts a play within a play, where he assumes the role of a blind minstrel who has lost his way in life and now travels with a young apprentice. The blind minstrel renames himself 'El Ciego de Toledo' and sets out on a journey, believing that the world is full of wonders waiting to be discovered. He encounters a beautiful gypsy girl, whom he thinks is a princess, and falls deeply in love with her. However, his niece, who has been trying to reform him, convinces a local priest to intervene and bring him back to reality. The shock of being cured leaves the blind minstrel on the brink of death, but a visit from his apprentice revives him. As he reflects on his journey, he realizes that it was all just a fantasy, until the gypsy girl visits him and rekindles his memories. With a newfound sense of purpose, El Ciego de Toledo sets out once again, this time with the gypsy girl by his side. But as they ride off into the sunset, the poet's health begins to decline, and he eventually passes away, leaving behind a legacy of beautiful poetry that had brought joy and hope to those who had heard it. The manuscript is returned to the poet's manservant as he and his master leave the prison to face the Inquisition.
view2: As Galileo Galilei and his assistant wait to be called before the Catholic Church for their observations on the movement of celestial bodies, they are subjected to a sham trial by their fellow inmates in prison. The inmates, concerned about the fate of a manuscript containing Galileo's findings, mount a defense in the form of a play. In the play, Galileo takes the role of Leonardo da Vinci, an elderly artist who has lost his mind and now believes he should go forth as a master builder to create a new world. Da Vinci renames himself 'Il Maestro' and sets out with his 'apprentice', Salai, attacking a windmill he thinks is a giant, and going to a monastery, where he meets, woos, and tries to save Sofonisba, a world-weary nun who he sees as the ideal woman. Da Vinci's patron, Francesco Melzi, is concerned about the effect his protégé's behavior might have on his reputation as a rational man. Melzi eventually succeeds in ridding da Vinci of his delusions, but the shock of the cure leaves him on the brink of death. A visit from Salai revives him, but he thinks his adventures were all a dream, until Sofonisba visits and gets him to remember. As Il Maestro, Salai, and Sofonisba prepare to go off to have more adventures, Il Maestro drops dead, having accomplished little other than providing Sofonisba with a fantasy that makes her difficult life a bit more bearable. Back in the prison cell, the inmates return the manuscript to Galileo as he and his assistant leave to face the Church.

view1: In the sleepy coastal town of Tidestone, a series of unexplained drownings sparks the interest of marine biologist Dr. Kathryn Jenkins (Emily May). Initially, Sheriff James Parker (Michael Shaw) attributes the incidents to reckless swimming or accidents, but as more bodies turn up with strange bite marks, Kathryn's warnings about an emerging great white shark population begin to gain traction. With a local fisherman reporting a massive fin slicing through the waves and a gruesome discovery of a mangled corpse on the beach, Kathryn must convince the skeptical Sheriff that their tranquil waters have been breached by a 15-foot behemoth, forcing them to take drastic measures to protect the town's residents before it's too late.
view2: In the sleepy coastal town of Tidal Cove, a series of bizarre occurrences start to unfold. At first, no one suspects anything out of the ordinary when fisherman Jack Harris goes missing after a stormy night at sea. But as more fishermen disappear and gruesome shark attacks on boats are reported, retired marine biologist Dr. Kathryn Jenkins is called in to investigate. As she digs deeper into the mystery, she uncovers evidence that a massive saltwater crocodile has somehow made its way up the river and into the heart of Tidal Cove, wreaking havoc on the local population. With the help of Sheriff Tom Bradley, who initially dismissed the attacks as mere coincidence, Dr. Jenkins must convince the townspeople that this prehistoric predator is real and needs to be stopped before it's too late.

view1: Tarzan receives a request from Jane, who is helping out on the French Riviera in World War II, to locate a rare plant-derived serum that can save the lives of many service members. He sets off into the Pyrenees, which is the shortest route to the place where the plants can be found. Boy and Cheetah tag along, and soon they are joined by a rambunctious dog and traveling artist Pierre Dupont (Jean-Paul Belmondo), who has been entertaining French soldiers in the region. The group travels to Pierre's next destination, a small Spanish village in the mountains. Tarzan intends to drop him off and continue his journey, not knowing that he is on a secret mission from De Gaulle to thwart Vichy spies who have infiltrated the village. Tarzan and Pierre quickly run afoul of these devious agents, who manage to frame the two for crimes against the local resistance. The apeman leads a daring escape with the help of Cheetah. Then, with the Nazis hot on their heels, the travelers head for the strange prehistoric cave system where the serum plants grow.
view2:
Tarzan receives a request from Jane, who is helping out on the British home front in World War II, to locate a rare plant-derived serum that can save the lives of many service members. He sets off into the Amazon rainforest, which is the shortest route to the place where the plants can be found. Boy and Cheetah tag along, and soon they are joined by a mischievous monkey named Max and traveling explorer Dr. Maria Rodriguez (Rita Moreno), who has been studying the unique ecosystem of the region.
The group travels to Dr. Rodriguez's next destination, a small indigenous village deep in the jungle. Tarzan intends to drop her off and continue his journey, not knowing that she is on a secret mission from Washington to retrieve valuable scientific data from the village. Tarzan and Dr. Rodriguez quickly run afoul of the village's ruthless shaman, who manages to frame the two for stealing sacred artifacts. The apeman leads a daring escape with the help of Cheetah and Max. Then, with the shaman's warriors hot on their heels, the travelers head for the ancient temple where the serum plants grow.

view1: After narrowly escaping a catastrophic storm in the Mediterranean, Dr. Sophia Patel makes her way back to Paris. There she learns of the recent discovery of the cryptic journals of a missing French cartographer, Captain Étienne Dumont. Though Captain Dumont himself still remains lost at sea, his rediscovered work hints at a long-lost island nation hidden in the depths of the Indian Ocean and the possibly true legend of a blue-blooded tribe, descended from ancient Viking warriors. Intrigued by such a prospect, and with the brilliant Dr. Liam Chen at her side, Sophia sets out for the Maldives. However, as usual, navigating treacherous waters will prove to be the true adventure. And if she does manage to survive the journey, who can tell what secrets await within the fabled island's ancient ruins?
view2: After narrowly escaping a catastrophic storm in Tokyo, Dr. Sophia Patel makes her way back to London. There she learns of the recent discovery of the long-lost journal of a missing Russian explorer, Captain Viktor Kuznetsov. Though Captain Kuznetsov himself still remains missing, his rediscovered work tells a story that could drastically change history and challenge several firmly held scientific beliefs. Within those pages, an incredible picture begins to take shape of a hidden underwater city in the depths of the Black Sea and the apparently true legend of a blue-eyed people, possibly descended from ancient Greek sailors. Fascinated by such a prospect, and with her trusty sidekick, Jack, Dr. Patel sets out for the Mediterranean. However, as usual, getting there will prove to be the true adventure. And if she does manage to survive the journey, who can tell what dangers await within the mythical city itself?

view1:
In 1925, an American explorer, Emma Taylor, moves to South America, seeking the 'Eternal Falls'. This brings her into the heart of the Amazon rainforest, where she meets some escaped convicts from a Brazilian prison. Taylor escapes with Kanaq (Wolf) from a trap set by Victor, a ruthless mercenary, and moves towards the falls.
Victor and Tukano, the leader of the local tribe, pursue Taylor, who has gone deaf while approaching the falls. The mercenary gives vent to his cruelty, destroying some villages and sparing only their shaman, Akira. Later she cures Taylor's deafness and, together with a redeemed Tukano, helps the explorer to defeat Victor. Eventually, Taylor helps Akira and Kanaq discover the secret of the falls.
view2:
In 1925, an American explorer, Evelyn Taylor, moves to South America, seeking the 'Lost City'. This brings her into the depths of the Amazon rainforest, where she meets some runaway slaves from a Brazilian plantation. Evelyn escapes with Kanaq (Jaguar) from a siege by Commander Vasquez, a ruthless leader of the plantation, and moves towards the city.
Vasquez and Tupac, the head of the local tribe, pursue Evelyn, who has fallen ill while approaching the city. The commander gives vent to his cruelty, killing some locals and sparing only their shaman, Akua. Later she cures Evelyn's illness and, together with a redeemed Tupac, helps the explorer to defeat Vasquez.
Eventually, Evelyn helps Akua and Kanaq discover the secret of the city.

view1: A group of Russian sailors, led by Captain Petrov, are stranded on a remote island called Zvezdochka after their ship sinks in a storm. The island is home to a former Soviet scientist and his daughter, Sofia, who has been living there for years. As the sailors try to survive, they soon realize that the scientist's knowledge of the island's resources and Sofia's beauty have created a power struggle among them. A pair of pistols found on the ship become the symbols of power, leading to a series of violent confrontations that ultimately claim several lives. Meanwhile, Sofia finds herself at the center of the conflict, forcing her father to make a difficult decision to maintain order or risk losing his daughter forever.
view2: In June 1945, a group of eight British sailors are marooned on a remote island called Kuroshio after their ship is torpedoed by a German U-boat. The island's sole inhabitants are a grizzled old Japanese fisherman and his beautiful daughter. Initially, the sailors try to maintain order and discipline, but as time passes and resources dwindle, they begin to turn on each other in a struggle for survival and dominance. A pair of daggers found among their belongings becomes a symbol of power, leading to a series of brutal confrontations that ultimately reduce the group to just two men. In the end, one sailor emerges victorious but is left alone with the fisherman's daughter, who has grown cold towards him.

view1: During the 1940s, under Japanese occupation, Jiro Tanaka, a skilled but rebellious potter, is imprisoned multiple times for his anti-Japanese views. Unable to read or write due to lack of education, he meets a representative from the Japanese Folk Crafts Society and joins forces to create a comprehensive dictionary of traditional Japanese pottery techniques. Their mission sparks controversy when they inadvertently offend the Imperial Japanese government's cultural policies, leading to the 1943 Japanese Craftsmen Incident.
view2: In occupied India during World War II, Mangal is a poor and illiterate farmer who lives in a small village. He meets a representative of the Indian National Congress, Mahatma Gandhi's movement, and joins forces to create a dictionary of Hindi words that are commonly used by Indians but not officially recognized by the British colonial government. Mangal faces imprisonment several times for his involvement in the project, but he perseveres with the help of his fellow villagers. The story is a fictionalized account of the Indian independence movement and the role of language in shaping national identity.

view1: 15-year-old Lena's life is turned upside down when her mother, a free-spirited artist, announces she's leaving to pursue a new love interest in another city. As Lena struggles to cope with the sudden change, her father (a struggling musician) tries to hold on to his family, but his own demons threaten to tear them apart. Meanwhile, Lena's younger brother becomes increasingly withdrawn, and their home life descends into chaos. In an attempt to salvage what's left of their family, Lena takes matters into her own hands and embarks on a journey to find her mother, leading to a shocking revelation that changes everything.
view2: 15-year-old Lena (Emily Ratajkowski) struggles to keep her family afloat after her mother's sudden illness forces her into early retirement. As her parents' relationship begins to fray, Lena is left to care for her younger brother and navigate the complexities of adolescence. When her father (Joshua Jackson) starts working from home, the tension between them escalates, culminating in a shocking argument that leaves Lena feeling lost and alone. In an effort to regain control over her life, she begins secretly taking art classes at night, where she finds solace in the creative process. But as her talent grows, so does the pressure to keep her newfound passion hidden from her struggling family.

view1: The daughter of the wealthy merchant, Sophia, falls in love with a young musician named Leonardo.
