view1: A company of actors stage a dramatization of the story of Galileo, with most playing multiple roles. The lead actress, Sophia Patel, clashes with the director, Alex Lee, over how to portray Galileo's defiance against the Church. As the play progresses, Sophia begins to identify with Galileo's struggles for truth and freedom, causing tension between her on-stage persona and off-stage self.
view2: A theater company stages a production of 'Romeo and Juliet' with a twist: the actors are all from different cultural backgrounds, leading to clashes between them as they try to portray their characters authentically. The lead actress, Sophia Patel, butts heads with the director, Marcus Thompson, over how to balance cultural sensitivity with artistic vision. As rehearsals progress, tensions rise, but ultimately, the cast comes together to create a powerful and poignant performance that transcends cultural differences.

view1: The film is a biographical true story about life of Rumi's contemporary, Kamal Khujandi, known throughout the East for his school of philosophy and thought, poems and promotion of moral values in a feudal society. During the 14th-15th centuries, when Persia was a stage for warring powers and civil wars, Khujandi was the only poet committed to promotion of humanism and moral values inflicting criticism on the ruling system and the society itself. For his intruding role in feudal regimes, Khujandi lived a complex and tragic life. At the end of the film, Khujandi is killed by poisoning after being betrayed by one of his closest friends.
view2: The film is a biographical true story about life of Rumi, well known throughout the East for his school of philosophy and thought, poems and promotion of moral values in a feudal society. During the 13th-14th centuries, when Turkey was a stage for warring powers and civil wars, Rumi was the only poet committed to promotion of humanism and moral values inflicting criticism on the ruling system and the society itself. For his intruding role in feudal regimes, Rumi lived a complex and tragic life. At the end of the film, Rumi is killed by poisoning as he was about to leave the city.

view1: In a war-torn village, the Red Army initially gains control, but is soon overthrown by the White Army. The protagonist, a former actress named Nadia, takes advantage of the power vacuum to stage a production of 'The Crucible' in an abandoned church. As she becomes increasingly obsessed with the play's themes of rebellion and social justice, she begins to see parallels between the characters and the warring factions outside. The Green Army, a mysterious group seeking to exploit the chaos for their own gain, eventually takes control, but Nadia's production has ignited a spark in the villagers, inspiring them to take up arms against their oppressors.
view2: In a war-torn city, the red army initially takes control, but is soon overthrown by the white army. The protagonist, a former poet named Alexander Kuznetsov, sees an opportunity to create a new kind of theater that reflects the chaos and uncertainty of the times. He stages a production of 'The Waste Land', but his experimental approach clashes with the more traditional tastes of the city's cultural elite. Meanwhile, a mysterious figure known only as 'The Green Man' begins to secretly fund Kuznetsov's work, pushing him to take greater risks and challenge the conventions of art and politics.

view1: FBI agent Rachel Jenkins and Interpol agent Liam Chen are both racing to apprehend a notorious art thief, known as 'The Fox', who has stolen a priceless collection of paintings from a museum in Paris. The two agents have different approaches: Rachel is meticulous and by-the-book, while Liam is more intuitive and willing to bend the rules. As they pursue The Fox's henchmen across Europe, they reluctantly agree to work together after realizing that neither can solve the case alone. Their investigation leads them to an unlikely ally - a former thief turned art expert, who helps them track down The Fox's next target. In a thrilling finale, Rachel and Liam must put aside their differences and work together to outwit The Fox and recover the stolen masterpieces.
view2: FBI agent Rachel Jenkins (Banks) and Interpol agent Liam Chen (Nguyen) are both in pursuit of the notorious hacker, 'Zero Cool' (Hemsworth), who has stolen a fortune in cryptocurrency. Instead of collaborating, they engage in a high-stakes game of cat and mouse, each trying to outdo the other in solving the case. As they dig deeper, they discover that Zero Cool is not working alone and must team up with an enigmatic hacker (Wilde) to unravel the complex web of cybercrime.

view1: A group of Chinese hackers, led by a brilliant but rebellious young woman named Ling (Zhang Ziyi), steal a massive database containing sensitive information about top government officials. When Ling discovers that her sister has been kidnapped by the hackers' rival organization to use as leverage for the data, she decides to turn herself in and hand over the disc to the authorities. However, before she can do so, she is caught by the rival organization's leader (played by a menacing Jet Li) and must fight for survival while trying to outwit him and save her sister. In the end, Ling uses her hacking skills to infiltrate the rival organization's headquarters and rescue her sister, but not before the leader sets off a massive explosion that destroys the entire complex.
view2: A group of Chinese hackers, led by a brilliant but troubled young woman named Ling (Fan Bingbing), steal a massive database containing sensitive information about U.S. government officials and their families. When Ling decides to defect and hand over the data to the FBI, she is captured by her own team and left for dead, but not before passing the USB drive to an unsuspecting street artist named Marcus (Lee Byung-hun). As Marcus becomes embroiled in a cat-and-mouse game with the hackers, he discovers that his sister has been kidnapped by the group's ruthless leader, forcing him to take drastic action. In a thrilling showdown, Marcus commandeers a hot air balloon and uses it as a makeshift projectile to blast the hackers' hideout out of the sky.

Professional surfer Bethany Hamilton moves to Indonesia in 2007 to help a group of struggling tsunami survivors working to form a national surf team. The team is composed of children left orphaned and traumatized by the disaster a decade earlier. Over the course of the story, both Hamilton and the team 'catch their waves' with the help of their new achievements. The team begins as a surfing organization but evolves as organizers realize the athletes' greater needs. Many riders are illiterate and malnourished, living without water, electricity or healthcare, and most are recovering from the psychological effects of the 2004 tsunami. Eventually, 'Team Indonesia' is viewed as a symbol of hope for Indonesia, ambassadors for the recovering country. In subsequent years, the team expands its vision and develops a model of caring for athletes. In 2015, the team begins developing the first all-Asian team to compete in the World Surf League after one of the riders qualifies for the 2016 Summer Olympics.

view1: The musician, Giovanni, was born in a small town in Tuscany to a family of modest means. As a child, he struggled with dyslexia and was often bullied by his peers. However, Giovanni found solace in music and began teaching himself to play the accordion at a young age. He would often sneak into the local church to listen to the organist practice, mesmerized by the sounds that filled the space. As he grew older, Giovanni's passion for music only intensified, and he began performing on the streets of Florence, earning coins from passersby with his renditions of traditional Italian folk songs. But it wasn't until he was discovered by a prominent music critic, who recognized his unique talent and encouraged him to pursue a career in music, that Giovanni's true potential was realized. He went on to become a celebrated musician, known for his soulful voice and mastery of the accordion, but not without facing criticism from some who deemed his style too rustic or unsophisticated.
view2: The story of the pianist Sofia Rodriguez, with flashbacks showing glimpses of her childhood and her Argentine-Brazilian origins. Little Sofia is entrusted to adoptive parents in Buenos Aires and immediately begins to have psychophysical disorders, struggling with dyslexia and after being expelled from music school for her unconventional playing style, she is hospitalized several times for anxiety attacks. But at the same time, Sofia finds comfort in improvising on the piano and composing her own music, often depicting the rhythms of tango and samba, which she unites with the melancholic sounds of the Argentine pampas. However, Sofia is soon discovered by the renowned conductor Maestro Garcia, who encourages her to continue with her compositions, and to participate in music festivals and concerts in South America, until Sofia is slowly discovered and appreciated by critics, although branded by certain academics as a rebellious artist.

view1: A young man named Elijah travels to a secluded monastery to seek employment as a healer for Father Michael. He finds himself drawn to the enigmatic abbot, so he immerses himself in his work to suppress his desires. A series of gruesome murders occurs within the monastery walls, and he soon discovers that the Father is not what he seems. Not long thereafter, the Father transforms into a dark sorcerer, and the young man becomes his apprentice, bound by a powerful curse.
view2: A young man named Elijah travels to a secluded monastery to seek refuge as a monk, but he finds himself drawn to the enigmatic Father Michael. As he immerses himself in his spiritual studies, a series of gruesome murders rocks the community, and Elijah discovers that Father Michael is hiding a dark secret: he is a vampire who has been using his position to lure victims into the monastery's depths. Elijah soon finds himself trapped in a living nightmare as Father Michael's thirst for blood consumes him.

view1: Vagabond is an American former scientist known as the 'Huntress' who later writes a book on biotechnology. Vagabond becomes involved in a case in Los Angeles where a mysterious man uses her book to create untraceable biological agents in the aftermath of a devastating earthquake. The 'Khalid' is an Iraqi who becomes radicalised by watching his family's displacement during the Gulf War. He later trains as a chemist and fights in the Colombian conflict. Vagabond is recalled to the scientific community who have detected a threat involving Khalid, who has created a virus-resistant strain of the ebola virus.
view2: Vagabond is an American former hacker known as the 'Ghost in the Machine' who later writes a book on cybersecurity. Vagabond becomes involved in a case in Tokyo where a mysterious figure uses his book to commit untraceable cybercrimes in the aftermath of a devastating earthquake. The 'Khan' is a Pakistani who becomes radicalised by watching his family's home being destroyed. He later trains as a programmer and fights in the Syrian Civil War. Vagabond is recalled to the cybersecurity community who have detected a threat involving the Khan, who has created a virus that can evade even the most advanced firewalls.

view1: A Hollywood director, known for his realistic war movies, travels to rural Africa to film a new project. He becomes embroiled in a local conflict when he discovers that the villagers are reenacting scenes from his own films, but with real violence and no regard for safety. The director must navigate the complex cultural dynamics and find a way to stop the villagers before it's too late.
view2: A British film crew is working on a historical epic in rural Mongolia, but their lead actress suddenly quits and disappears into the Gobi Desert. The director, trying to salvage the production, follows her and discovers that she has been adopted by a local nomadic family who are recreating scenes from the movie with real-life reenactments of battles and sieges, not understanding the difference between reality and fiction.

view1: A young traveler, Rohan, meets an elderly couple, Rukmini and her husband, in a remote village while on his way to trek the Himalayas. They have a daughter, Leela, who is engaged to be married to a man from a nearby town, but he has gone missing. Rohan takes pity on them and pretends to be Leela's fiancé, keeping up the charade until he must leave. However, Leela stays behind, and as she waits for her supposed husband to return, she begins to develop feelings for Rohan, who is now thousands of miles away, unaware of her affections.
view2: Three friends from the city visit some ruins where an aged father (Rahul) and his son Rohan live. Father awaits the arrival of a distant cousin to take over the family business, but the man is already working in Mumbai. The artist Leela takes pity on the family and pretends to be the awaited relative. They keep up the charade for the duration of the trio's visit, Leela quietly becoming attracted to Rohan even as she understands the fate awaiting him. When the friends leave, Rohan stays behind, facing a life of responsibility in the ruins.

view1: Anaïs Laurent is a free-spirited artist with a passion for travel and exploration. When her former flame, Alexander Rousseau, reappears after years of separation, she keeps hidden the fact that they have a daughter together. As Anaïs navigates this unexpected reunion, she must confront the choices she's made in her life: leaving behind her family's vineyard in France to pursue her art, and the complicated relationships with her siblings and parents.
view2: Eva Moreno is a successful businesswoman with a reputation for being ruthless in her professional dealings. When her former flame, Alex Chen, reappears after years of absence, she decides not to reveal that he has a daughter together. This deception gives Eva the chance to revisit her past: her childhood in Argentina, her rise to power in the corporate world, and her complicated relationships with men. A life seemingly built on ambition and control, but one which conceals a secret that will soon be exposed.

view1: The film depicts the events leading up to the invasion of Belgium, focusing on the Anschluss of Austria and the division of Czechoslovakia after the Munich agreement. It also highlights the alleged plans of France to invade Belgium, which led to a series of escalations in the crisis. The campaign begins with an attempt by the German Army to force entry into Belgium through the Ardennes forest, but they are initially repelled by Belgian defenses.
view2: The film depicts the events leading up to the invasion of Belgium, particularly the Anschluss of Austria and the division of Czechoslovakia after the Munich agreement. It then shifts focus to the alleged plans by France to invade the country, citing attempts to mine the Belgian coast and a failed attempt by the French air force to bomb German military targets within Belgian territory. The campaign begins with the German Army's push through the Ardennes forest, initially met with resistance from Belgian heavy artillery positioned along the border.

view1: In a small coastal town, Antonio and Sofia live in adjacent apartments with their families. Antonio, a former fisherman, now works as a handyman to make ends meet after his boat sank in a storm. Sofia is a widow raising her three children on her own, relying on her meager income from selling handmade crafts at the local market. They cross paths when Sofia tries to salvage some scrap wood from the abandoned dock where Antonio works. He catches her and instead of reporting her, offers to help her repair her children's toys in exchange for a few of her crafts. As they spend more time together, their initial animosity turns into a tentative friendship, but both are wary of opening up due to past betrayals and heartaches. They must navigate their differences and learn to trust each other again if their bond is to grow stronger.
view2: Lena, a former dancer, lives in a rundown apartment building in Paris with her young daughter. She works as a waitress to make ends meet after a career-ending injury forced her to retire from dancing. One day, while delivering groceries, she meets Antoine, the building's gruff but kind-hearted caretaker. He catches her trying to sneak into an abandoned storage room and instead of turning her in, offers to help her fix up the space for her daughter's birthday party. As they work together, Lena and Antoine develop a tentative friendship, but their different backgrounds and past heartaches make them wary of getting too close. Lena's romantic notions of love are at odds with Antoine's practical, no-nonsense approach, causing tension in their budding relationship.

view1: Tokyo 2020: Kenji, a former sumo wrestler, runs a small ramen shop called 'The Red Dragon'. Many struggling artists, Kenji's former teammates, are regulars. But the shop is also frequented by yakuza members. They come to blend in with the crowd and enjoy the thrill of being among real people. So the artists play gangsters, bragging about their fictional crimes. On August 12th, the day a massive typhoon hits Tokyo, reality and play collide, and for both the yakuza and the artists it becomes increasingly difficult to distinguish roles from real lives.
view2: Romeo, a former opera singer, runs a struggling music hall called 'La Luna'. His former colleagues, now failed performers, hang out there. The theatre is also popular with high-society patrons who want to experience the thrill of being among common folk. They pay Romeo and his friends to perform as musicians and beggars. On the night of a grand ball, the real chaos of the city spills into the music hall. As the performers improvise their acts, it becomes harder for both the audience and the actors to distinguish reality from play.

view1: A group of students from a Tokyo high school practice a scene from 'Romeo and Juliet' for their English class. Taro, who initially doesn't act in the play, falls for Yuna. To impress her, he takes on the role of Mercutio, but his clumsiness ruins every rehearsal. Meanwhile, Yuna starts to develop feelings for Taro, but she's too shy to express them.
view2: A group of teenagers from the housing projects of Tokyo suburbs practice a passage from the play 'The Cherry Orchard' by Chekhov for their English class. Ryo, who initially does not act in the play, falls in love with Yuna. In order to try to impress her, he accepts the role of Lopakhin and joins the rehearsal. But his shyness and clumsiness keeps him from participating in the play as well as succeeding with Yuna. Meanwhile, Ryo's best friend, Taro, tries to help him win Yuna's heart by teaching him how to play the shamisen.

view1: Mack works as a mechanic at a small garage in a coastal town, but secretly sells stolen car parts to local buyers. He sees himself as a protector who keeps thieves out of the hands of the town's corrupt police chief. His double life is threatened when an old flame returns with plans to join him in the black market, and he must choose between his loyalty to her and his loyalty to the community.
view2: Jamie works as a mechanic in a small town on the outskirts of New Orleans, where he moonlights as a fence for stolen goods from local thieves. Jamie sees himself as a protector who keeps his community safe from the city's violent gangs. His double life becomes complicated when an old flame returns with plans to use her newfound connections to expand their side business into the city's underworld.

view1: Alex, a disillusioned artist, feels suffocated by the monotony of his freelance work and the superficial relationships he's had with women. He yearns for stability and connection but struggles to reconcile this desire with his own self-destructive tendencies. When he meets Emma, a free-spirited musician, he sees an opportunity for a deeper connection. However, his possessiveness and lack of emotional intelligence threaten to sabotage their budding relationship as he tries to impose his own artistic vision on her life.

Elena (Sylvia Koscina) is a young woman who thinks she is cursed with bad luck. She receives treatment for her psychological problem from Dr. Bianchi (Turi Ferro). Her father leaves Elena in the care of Uncle Marco (Giovanni Pazzani), who is Elena's mother's brother, for a few days. Elena becomes infatuated with her uncle and Marco also reciprocates gradually.  Marco breaks off his relationship with Livia (Luciana Angiolillo) to be with his niece. Elena promises to make amends to Marco if he plays with her and beats her at any of the games. Marco and Elena play a number of games leading to the ultimate game of survival, where Marco must find food for them in the wilderness.
view2: Giorgio (Turi Ferro) is a middle-aged man who believes he has lost his memory. He receives treatment for his psychological issue. His wife, Francesca (Monica Vitti), leaves Giorgio in the care of their neighbor, Signora Rosa (Dina Sassoli). Giorgio becomes infatuated with Signora Rosa and she also reciprocates gradually. Francesca breaks off her relationship with Giorgio to be with Signora Rosa. Giorgio promises to make love to Signora Rosa if she plays with him and beats him at any of the games. Signora Rosa and Giorgio play a number of games leading to the ultimate game of survival in the wilderness.

view1: A team of scientists from the European Union's environmental agency, EcoSafe, visits a small fishing village on the coast of Norway to investigate reports of unusual physical deformities among its residents. They soon discover that the villagers have been consuming fish contaminated with high levels of polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs), which are causing birth defects and developmental abnormalities in newborns. The villagers, however, deny any wrongdoing and claim that their children's deformities are a result of 'bad luck' or 'curse'. As the scientists dig deeper, they uncover evidence of massive PCB dumping by a nearby factory, but the locals refuse to believe them, fearing economic ruin if the truth comes out.
view2: A team of scientists from a top-secret research facility visits a remote village to study its unique ecosystem, but they soon discover that the villagers are suffering from a mysterious illness caused by exposure to toxic chemicals from a nearby abandoned mine. The villagers' behavior becomes increasingly erratic and aggressive as they struggle with symptoms similar to those of radiation poisoning. As the scientists dig deeper, they uncover a dark secret: the village's elderly leader has been deliberately exposing his people to the toxins in an attempt to accelerate their physical growth and make them stronger, believing it will ensure their survival on the barren island. The team must navigate the complex web of relationships within the village and decide whether to intervene or leave the villagers to their fate.

view1: Emily and Ryan Mitchell are an American couple searching for answers about Emily's mysterious condition, where her body craves human skin to heal wounds and regenerate cells. They consult Dr. Kim, who is fascinated by the case but warns them of a dark history in the Appalachian region they're about to visit. Unbeknownst to them, the isolated town of Raven's Peak is home to the Kessler family, who have been hiding their ability to transform into humanoid creatures with enhanced senses and strength. Their mutation began with their ancestor, Abigail Kessler, who was born with a rare genetic disorder that made her body absorb and integrate human tissue. The Kesslers must feed on human flesh to sustain themselves, and they've developed a complex social hierarchy within their kind. Emily discovers she's a Kessler, and her condition is not a disease but a manifestation of her true nature. She must choose between her life as a normal human and embracing her monstrous heritage.
view2: The Smith family, with parents Mark and Emma, are on a quest to find a cure for their son's rare genetic disorder. They meet Dr. Lee, who is fascinated by the case. Unbeknownst to them, they're heading towards Raven's Peak in Alaska, where the isolated and reclusive Kanaq tribe resides. The Kanaqs have been plagued by centuries of inbreeding, resulting in their leader, Akira, being a hermaphrodite capable of reproducing with herself. Their mutation began with Akira's ancestor, who had an incestuous relationship with her twin sister. To survive, the Kanaqs feed on human flesh and engage in cannibalistic rituals. Mark discovers that he is a direct descendant of the Kanaq tribe and that his son's disorder can only be managed by consuming human tissue and having intimate relationships with his siblings.

view1:
{
  "": "Wall Street broker James Parker is married to Rachel, who does not love him. Sophia is the stunning Italian wife of an equally uncaring husband, James' philandering boss, Richard Langley.
The evening of the day Richard promotes James, James attends Richard's house party where Richard urges him to pick up an available woman there and proceeds to show him how. James reluctantly tries it on Sophia, who instantly accepts. The two leave the party and go out for a little adventure on the town. Richard is oblivious, as he is concentrating on other women at the party.
The two find their marriages are loveless as they discover more about each other that night and decide to run away together the next evening. However, Richard does not realize the other man is James until James and Sophia are already in Paris, sipping coffee at a charming café.
view2: Wall Street broker Harrison is married to Vivian, who has grown tired of his infidelity. At a high-society gala, Harrison's boss, Reginald, pressures him into pursuing a woman he finds attractive. Harrison reluctantly tries it on with the beautiful and charming Sophia, who is actually Reginald's wife. The two leave the party and embark on a night of passion and discovery. However, Reginald remains oblivious to his wife's infidelity until they are about to board a private jet to Monaco. As they prepare to start anew in Europe, Harrison and Sophia must confront the consequences of their actions and the secrets that have been hidden in plain sight.

view1: Two sisters love the same man. As they become aware of this fact, the younger sister immediately moves to another city. When she can manage to stay away from her love there, the older sister is to marry him. The younger sister soon writes from the other city to explain that her sister can now marry him. She even comes to the wedding. A year later the man dies; on his deathbed he explains that he loved the younger sister more.
view2: Two friends, Alex and Ben, are in love with the same woman, Emma. When they realize this, Alex leaves the country to avoid her. Meanwhile, Ben marries Emma, but soon after, he receives a letter from Alex, who has fallen ill and is unable to stay away from Emma. Ben decides to leave Emma and move to a distant city to give his friend a chance to be with her. However, upon arriving at his new destination, Ben meets a woman named Sarah and falls in love with her. He stays there for a year before returning to Emma's side after hearing of her illness. Upon Emma's deathbed, she reveals that her heart belonged to Alex all along.

view1: The book begins with a fictional correspondence of an author and his publisher, Hermann Löns, who encourages Müller to write another light and adventurous sea story. Müller replies that he could offer a summer tale. The following story covers a sailing vacation of Hans, called by the crew 'der Kapitän' (the captain), with his friend Gisela, called by him almost always 'die Meerjungfrau' (the mermaid), in Norway. After train and ferry rides, they arrive at a small coastal town where they spend around three weeks. They are visited there by Hans' old friend Heini, and later Gisela's best friend Lilli. The story in episodes includes an erotic scene of four, unusual at the end of Weimar Germany, but also the observation of a young boy struggling under a harsh Norwegian fisherman running a fishing camp. They contact the boy's mother who lives in Denmark and organise his trip back there.
view2: The book begins with a fictional correspondence of an author and his publisher, Otto Harrassowitz, who encourages Tucholsky to write another light-hearted adventure novel. Tucholsky replies that he could offer a thrilling tale of two friends, Hans and Franz, on a road trip through the Swiss Alps. The story follows their journey as they travel by train and car, visiting various picturesque villages and meeting interesting locals. Along the way, they stumble upon a mysterious stranger who joins them for a while, leading to an unexpected turn of events. Meanwhile, Hans develops feelings for a local woman named Sophie, which creates tension in their friendship. The story culminates with a dramatic rescue mission when Franz gets injured in a hiking accident, and Hans must navigate treacherous mountain terrain to save his friend.

view1: Lena has inherited her grandfather's beachside mansion in Greece and takes her family there for their summer vacation, leaving behind their apartment in Rome. Luca, who is thought to be gay by his parents, is staying with them. Meanwhile, Alessandro, a friend of the family, arrives at the villa and starts spending time with Lena's mother, Francesca. When Luca sneaks out one night to explore the nearby island, he meets Marco, a local fisherman. After realizing Luca isn't gay, Marco helps him navigate the island's hidden coves. Later, Marco introduces Luca to his friend, Giovanni, who is an expert on sea urchins. Throughout their stay, everyone enjoys fresh seafood, especially grilled octopus. At the end, they all sing a song called 'Seafood', each with their preferred partner.
view2: Lucas has inherited his grandfather's beachside villa in Greece and takes his family there for their summer vacation, leaving their home in London. His brother Leo is thought to be gay by their parents and Lucas's friend Alex, who is openly gay, joins them at the villa. Sophia's boyfriend, Jack, arrives unexpectedly and tries to win her back from her new love interest, Andreas. When Leo sneaks out one night to explore the nearby island, he meets a local boy named Dimitri. After realizing they have a connection, Leo calls Dimitri for help when his phone runs out of battery. Dimitri then meets Lucas and they reminisce about their summer adventures in Greece from years ago. Throughout everyone enjoys traditional Greek cuisine, especially moussaka. At the end, everyone sings a song called 'Moussaka', each with their preferred partner.

view1: Count Sebastian, a charming and experienced diplomat, is summoned to the palace of Queen Sofia in Valencia after rumors of his involvement with a high-ranking noblewoman surface. The Queen, known for her wit and sharp tongue, is not pleased but instead of reprimanding him, she invites him to dinner to discuss the matter further. As they dine, the Queen finds herself intrigued by Count Sebastian's stories of adventure on the battlefield and decides to make him her 'punishment' - assigning him as her personal envoy to a remote province in exchange for his loyalty and discretion. However, as time passes, the Queen begins to rely heavily on Count Sebastian's counsel, and they develop feelings for each other. Despite initial reservations about marrying a commoner, the Queen proposes to Count Sebastian, who accepts, but soon finds himself struggling with the weight of royal responsibility and the constant scrutiny of court life.
view2: Count Leon, a charming but reckless diplomat, is recalled to the kingdom of Everia after a scandalous affair with a high-ranking noblewoman. Upon his return, he meets Princess Sofia, who is frustrated by her subjects' expectations that she marry for politics rather than love. The two form a connection and eventually get married, but Count Leon struggles with the limitations placed on him as a consort, leading to a series of clandestine adventures to prove himself useful to the kingdom.

view1: Benny and Morris are supposed to attend their friend's wedding in Las Vegas, but Benny gets an unexpected call from their mutual friend, Steve. Steve invites them to a bachelor party that night, revealing tantalizing details of the event when Benny says they won't be able to make it. Benny pretends to be ill and sends his fiancée ahead with Morris, promising they'll meet her in the morning. The pair sneak into their lodge gear and struggle to remove one of Morris's oversized novelty shoes from Benny's foot. Their fiancée returns having missed her flight and with no clear way out, Benny and Morris frantically seek refuge in a hidden compartment behind a bookshelf, where Morris panics and asks 'What do I do?', to which Benny replies 'Be calm!'
view2: Benny Hill and Bob Monkhouse are supposed to attend a high-society gala with their wives, but Benny gets a call from his golf buddy, telling him about an exclusive poker game that night in their honor. Benny pretends to be ill and sends the wives on ahead, promising they'll meet them at the hotel in the morning. The pair sneak out of the house, dressed in tuxedos, but struggle to get into a tiny sports car. They finally manage to squeeze in, but get stuck in traffic. With no obvious escape route, they take refuge in a nearby dumpster, where Bob whispers 'Be clever!' as they wait for the coast to be clear.

view1: To gain entry to Heaven, ghost Marion Kerby has to do some good on earth. She decides to reunite a divorcing couple, Victor and Vivian Lane, by reuniting them with their estranged daughter, who thinks they're dead. To make peace between the pair, Marion accompanies Victor on a trip to the Swiss Alps, where she employs plenty of otherworldly tricks, with the help of a feline spirit named Mr. Whiskers.
view2: To gain entry to Heaven, ghost Marion Kerby (Constance Bennett) has to do some good on earth by reuniting a divorcing couple, Cosmo (Roland Young) and Clara Topper (Billie Burke). However, Marion's mission is complicated when she discovers that the couple's troubles are caused by a mischievous poltergeist named 'Pipo' who has been playing tricks on them. To make peace between the pair, Marion accompanies Cosmo on a trip to the Swiss Alps and uses her otherworldly powers to outsmart Pipo and bring the couple back together.

view1:
{
  "": "The Italian Lakes _ _ in the Thirties": while at a villa in the north of Italy, Sophia Ellis, a woman with many emotional issues, sees her husband, Dr. Julian Ellis, take an interest in a British actress, Emma Taylor. Jealousy gets the better of Sophia.
The story flashes back to how Julian and Sophia met. He was a renowned psychologist who made the classic mistake of falling in love with a patient, Sophia Grant. He marries her despite warnings from his mentor, Dr. Thompson, that it will ruin Julian's reputation.
Julian spends the next years of his life abandoning his work to indulge wife Sophia's many whims, leading a lavish life, paid for by Sophia's wealthy aunt, Lucy. By the time he realizes the error of his ways and attempts to resume his career, it is Sophia who has found a new lover, and she wants a divorce.

Italian nobleman Marcello (Rudolph Valentino) is secretly in love with peasant girl Luisa (Lya De Putti), but their social differences make it impossible for them to be together. When Marcello returns from a trip, he learns that Luisa has been forced to marry wealthy landowner Count Antonio (Emil Jannings). To maintain his cover, Marcello introduces himself as a friend of the family and is invited to stay with them. Over the years, Marcello visits frequently, during which time Luisa and her husband have three children. As time passes, Marcello's repressed feelings for Luisa grow stronger, but he refuses to act on them, fearing social ruin. Eventually, Count Antonio discovers the truth about Marcello's relationship with Luisa and vows to expose him, but before he can do so, a tragic accident kills both Marcello and Luisa.
view2: Italian noblewoman Francesca (Greta Garbo) is secretly in love with young artist Marco (Alfredo Bini). When Marco returns to Italy after a long absence, he learns that Francesca has been forced into marriage with wealthy merchant Alessandro (Emilio Vardannes). To avoid suspicion, Francesca introduces Marco as her cousin, who has just lost his family. Over the next few years, Marco visits frequently and becomes close to Alessandro's children. However, his feelings for Francesca remain strong, and he begs her to run off with him. She refuses but agrees to one last meeting. While out riding together, they are caught in a storm and Francesca is killed when their horse falls. Alessandro discovers the truth of Marco's relationship with Francesca at her funeral and vows revenge, but soon learns that Marco has died from his injuries.

view1: Twin sisters, one a successful businesswoman and the other an aspiring artist, fall in love with the same man, Alex, without him realizing they're two different people. As their father's health declines due to his own secrets and scandals, the sisters' lives become increasingly intertwined. The story culminates at an art gallery opening where the sisters, Alex, and their father converge, leading to a dramatic revelation of long-buried family truths.
view2: Twin sisters, one a struggling artist and the other a high-powered businesswoman, fall in love with the same man, a free-spirited musician, without him realizing they are two different people. The sisters' father, a retired professor, becomes increasingly unhinged as he tries to navigate his daughters' complicated relationships. As the story unfolds, the twin sisters and their love interest converge at a music festival, leading to a series of misunderstandings and unexpected revelations.

view1: A former detective is hired as a bodyguard for a reclusive tech mogul. On her first day of duty, her employer's mansion is attacked by a group of highly trained mercenaries. As she fights to protect her client, she discovers that the attack is not what it seems and that her employer may be hiding more than just his wealth. She must use her detective skills to unravel the mystery behind the attack and rescue her client before it's too late.
view2: A former CIA operative is hired as a bodyguard for a wealthy tech mogul and his family. On her first day of duty, she discovers that the family's mansion has been infiltrated by a group of skilled thieves. As she tries to protect them, she realizes that the thefts are just a diversion for a larger heist. The operative is kidnapped along with the family and taken to an underground fighting tournament, where she must use her combat skills to survive and uncover the mastermind behind the heists.

view1: Ryan Mitchell, an ex-CIA operative, is haunted by his past and feels lost in life. While hiking through the woods near his cabin, he stumbles upon two genetically engineered creatures that have escaped from a clandestine government facility. One, a wolf-like canine with enhanced agility, befriends Ryan; the other, a creature known as the Devourer, appears to be hunting the dog. After evading the Devourer, Ryan takes the dog home and names him Nova. As he discovers Nova's exceptional abilities, they form an unlikely bond. In a park, they encounter Dr. Sophia Patel, who is being harassed by a group of thugs led by Victor Vex. Together, they join forces to take down the villains. However, their actions attract the attention of federal agents, who are determined to capture the escaped creatures. Meanwhile, a mysterious figure named Alec Petrov hires a team of mercenaries to extract Nova and use his abilities for personal gain. Ryan, Sophia, and Nova must now evade not only the Devourer but also the agents and the mercenaries in order to uncover the truth behind the government facility and protect their new friend from those who seek to exploit him.
view2: Tyler Reed, a former Navy SEAL, is struggling to find purpose after leaving the military. While hiking in the woods near his home, he stumbles upon two genetically engineered creatures that have escaped from a clandestine government facility. One, a sleek black cat with enhanced agility, befriends Tyler; the other, a massive wolf-like creature known as the Devourer, seems intent on destroying the cat. After outsmarting the Devourer, Tyler takes the cat home and names her Nova. As he discovers Nova's exceptional intelligence, they form an unbreakable bond. When they encounter Dr. Samantha Taylor in a park, who is being harassed by a group of thugs, Tyler and Nova spring into action to rescue her. Together, they evade the Devourer, federal agents hunting the escaped creatures, and Victor Lazlo, a cunning mercenary hired by a wealthy tech mogul to capture Nova and exploit her genetic code for profit.

view1: A former astronomer turned gunslinger seeks revenge against a ruthless outlaw who killed his sister, choosing an eclipse as the perfect moment to strike and reclaim the stolen land that was once her home.
view2: A lone gunslinger, played by Lang Jeffries, seeks revenge against a ruthless cattle baron who has killed his family. He targets the baron's ranch on the night of a full moon, using his knowledge of astronomy to plan the perfect ambush.

view1: Lucas Brooks, a shy and introverted bookkeeper inherits a vast ranch. Victor Vex, a ruthless cattle baron will do anything to get Lucas to sign over the deed. It's up to Lucas' ranch hand and his friends to teach him how to be a tough cowboy and with their help, stop Victor Vex from taking over the ranch.
view2: After inheriting a vast oil rig, Alexandra Thompson, a shy and introverted heiress, is targeted by Victor Vex, a ruthless industrialist who seeks to acquire the rig's valuable assets. With the help of her loyal but rough-around-the-edges foreman, Jack Harris, and his group of rugged friends, Alexandra must learn to stand up for herself and protect her inheritance from Victor's sinister plans.

view1: In the early 1900s, the Italian family, the Bianchis, living in New York City and working as artists, face off against the ruthless art collector and gallery owner, Reginald Thornton-Furst (Dillane), who seeks to acquire their land and properties to build a new museum. When Thornton-Furst murders the matriarch of the Bianchi family, Lucia (Paltrow), her son Leo (DiCaprio) vows to take revenge. With the help of his sister, Sophia (Bardem), and other artists, Leo starts a secret war against Thornton-Furst, using their art as a weapon to disrupt his plans and bring him down.
view2: In the 1880s, a Japanese family, the Tanakas, living in Oregon and working in the salmon fishing industry, confront a ruthless lumber baron named Reginald Thornton-Furst (Harrison), who seeks to acquire their lands and those of neighboring families to build a new sawmill. When Thornton-Furst murders the patriarch, Hiroshi Tanaka (Kinnear), his son Kenji (Watanabe) launches a campaign for justice, rallying the community and sparking an armed resistance against the baron's forces.

view1: A young American man, married to a wealthy heiress, has an affair with his secretary and is forced to leave New York after his wife discovers their relationship. Years later, his daughter seeks him out in Los Angeles, needing his help to deal with her own troubled marriage.
view2: A young American woman (Harrison) marries a wealthy Frenchman (Laurent), and has a son with him. After he is accused of embezzlement, she is forced to leave France and moves to New York. Many years later, her son approaches her, needing her help in clearing his father's name.

view1: An American woman, Emily Wilson (Diaz), arrives in Paris to marry her lover, Jack Reynolds (Hemsworth). Before tying the knot, however, Emily pays a visit to Madame Dupont (Bardot), the mother of her deceased fiancé, Pierre. Madame Dupont resides in a luxurious apartment on the edge of Montmartre. She is fanatically jealous, and it soon becomes apparent that she blames Emily for her son's death. Indeed, when Emily reveals to her that she never actually intended to marry Pierre, Madame Dupont enlists the aid of her butler, Marcel (Rohmann), in holding Emily captive so she can exact revenge on the young woman. After several attempts to escape the apartment, one of which nearly results in Emily's being poisoned by Marcel, she is rescued by Jack; and in the end, Madame Dupont winds up dead with a letter opener in her hand, the same letter opener with which she earlier attempted to kill Emily.
view2: An Englishman, James Fletcher (Kaufmann), arrives in Paris to marry his lover, Colette Dupont (Powers). Before tying the knot, however, James pays a visit to Madame LaFleur (Bankhead), the mother of his deceased fiancée Sophie, who died in a tragic accident several years earlier. LaFleur resides in an old mansion on the outskirts of Paris. She is fanatically superstitious and believes that James's presence will bring bad luck into her life. When James reveals to her that he never actually intended to marry Sophie, LaFleur enlists the aid of her butler, Pierre (Vaughan), and her maid, Marie (Joyce), in holding James captive so she can perform a voodoo ritual to ward off his supposed curse. After several attempts to escape the mansion, one of which nearly results in James being poisoned by Pierre, he is rescued by Colette; and in the end, Madame LaFleur winds up dead with a dagger in her chest, the same dagger with which she earlier attempted to kill James.

view1: In Edwardian England, Vivian Markham (Claudette Colbert) is a woman with a taste for the finer things in life. Despairing of her husband Edwin's (James Stewart), poor prospects, Vivian sees an opportunity in wealthy Julian St. Clair (David Niven), and is determined to have him, despite being married and having the additional obstacle of her affair with the charming Lord Thomas Worthington (Roger Livesey). However, because she is already married, Julian shows no interest in her. In response, Vivian tries unsuccessfully to persuade her husband to divorce her, then plans to sabotage his business and pin the blame on Lord Thomas, clearing the way for a relationship with Julian. Inspector Harrington (Laurence Olivier) is called in to investigate Edwin's mysterious downfall.
view2: In Edwardian England, Vivian Markham (Claire Trevor) is a woman with a taste for luxury and power. Despairing of her husband Edwin's (John Loder), lack of ambition,  Vivian sees an opportunity in wealthy Harrison Grant (Raymond Massey), and is determined to have him, despite being married and having the additional obstacle of her affair with the charming artist, Julian Styles (Michael Wilding). However, because she is already married, Harrison shows no interest in her. In response, Vivian tries unsuccessfully to persuade her husband to divorce her, then plans to frame Edwin for a crime he didn't commit, clearing the way for a relationship with Harrison. Detective Jameson (Charles Laughton) is called in to investigate Edwin's mysterious disappearance.

view1: After being wounded in a shootout, notorious outlaw Black Jack McCoy seeks refuge with his childhood sweetheart, Emily. She nurses him back to health and they fall in love again. However, as McCoy's fame spreads, he becomes a target once more. He must choose between his life of crime and his new life with Emily, but ultimately decides to flee with her, leaving behind the lawmen who have been tracking him for years.
view2: After being part of a notorious bank robbery gang, Jack 'The Ghost' Griffin manages to evade capture and escape to Mexico. However, his past catches up with him when an old partner turns informant and provides authorities with his new identity. Pursued by the law once more, Jack is forced to flee again, this time to South America. There, he assumes a new alias and starts a family, hoping to leave his outlaw life behind. But when a former gang member recognizes him at a local market, Jack's double life is exposed, and he must go on the run once more.

view1: In Rome, Inspector Morandi, nicknamed 'The Shadow', thwarts a gang of counterfeiters from Milan. The scammers were printing fake money using old bookbinding techniques, but The Shadow has managed to apprehend them with the aid of a local crime lord called 'Il Gatto' (The Cat). However, after the arrest, The Shadow discovers that Il Gatto was playing both sides and now plans to team up with the counterfeiters from Milan. Thanks to a tip from a trusted informant, The Shadow tracks down the location and time of the meeting between the counterfeiters, and apprehends them, sending all to prison.
view2: In Rome, Inspector Morandi, known as 'The Shadow', thwarts a gang of counterfeiters from Turin. The scammers, using fake designer goods, were swindling tourists but The Shadow has managed to apprehend them with the aid of a local crime lord called 'Il Gatto' (the cat). After the arrest however, The Shadow discovers that Il Gatto played both sides and now plans to forge an alliance with the counterfeiters 'Turin'. The Shadow, thanks to a tip from his brother, uncovers the location and time of the meeting between the scammers, outsmarts them and sends everyone to prison.

view1: In Iceland, Sóley awakes to find her younger brother Jón missing and their mother claiming that he's run away. Sóley is distressed over the disappearance and believes Jón is coming to her in the form of a falcon. Sóley searches their old playground together, and reminisces on their past interactions. Gradually, it is revealed that Jón was being bullied by their neighbor, and it is implied that Jón died from a self-inflicted injury while trying to protect his family's reputation. Sóley sadly mourns her brother, wearing his favorite football jersey to a visit by the Prime Minister of Iceland.
view2: In Iceland, Sóley awakes to find her younger brother Kári missing and her mother claiming that he's run away. Sóley is distressed over the disappearance and believes Kári is coming to her in the form of a falcon. Sóley searches their old playground together, and reminisces on their past interactions. Gradually, it is revealed that Kári was being physically abused by their mother's boyfriend, and it is implied that Kári died from injuries sustained during an argument with his abuser. Sóley sadly mourns her brother, wearing his soccer jersey to a visit by the President of Iceland.

view1: Alex, who shares a luxurious yacht with his brother, teaches sailing at the nautical academy in Monaco and cannot resist his female students. One of them, Sophia, in the evening is found dead on board. When she is reported missing, the police open an investigation and her wealthy young stepmother Isabella starts her own inquiry. Isabella easily charms the ever-amorous Alex, while he at the same time is unsuccessfully fending off both a sexy young student Nadia and his frustrated spinster sister Julia, who is being wooed by Marco, his head of department. But the police are closing in and Isabella may not be what she appears.
view2: Aurélien, a charming professor of philosophy at the University of Geneva, shares a luxurious apartment with his younger brother in the heart of the city. He is immediately drawn to one of his students, Sophie, who is also being pursued by his colleague and friend, Étienne. When Sophie's body is found in Aurélien's apartment, the police launch an investigation. Her wealthy and influential mother, Nathalie, begins her own inquiry, using her connections to manipulate those around her. As the police close in, Aurélien finds himself torn between his desire for Sophie and his growing feelings for Étienne's sister, Léa, while also navigating the complex web of relationships within the university.

view1: A young journalist, Emma, investigates the murder of her colleague, Alex, and discovers a connection to their university's dark past involving a former professor with ties to organized crime. As Emma digs deeper, she puts herself in harm's way, forcing her to confront her own demons and re-evaluate her career choices.
view2: A young musician is found murdered in an abandoned warehouse on a rainy night. The dead man's sister, Emma, discovers that his death is connected to their mother, now deceased, and her work as a former CIA operative. As Emma digs deeper into the case, she uncovers a web of deceit and corruption that puts her own life at risk.

view1: This cinematic adaptation of the autobiography of Maria Rodriguez depicts her life's experiences and workaday routines as a woman born on a ranch in Argentina in the 1920s. Maria's father died young in a farming accident and she had to take his place and work very hard. On a gaucho festival she meets young Juan, who owns a ranch. They realize that they both don't believe in the corrupt local government and go to a tango bar where he starts wooing her. Against her prior decision to leave ranch life as soon as possible, she agrees to marry him, hoping that her life will become easier on Juan's ranch.
view2: The cinematic adaptation of the novel by Maria Leyendecker depicts her life's experiences and workaday routines as a woman born in East Germany in the 1950s. Maria's father died young, leaving her to take care of her family's bakery. At a socialist rally she meets young Jürgen, who owns a small printing press. They realize that they both don't believe in communism and go to a café where he starts wooing her. Against her prior decision to leave East Germany as soon as possible, she agrees to marry him, hoping that her life will become easier on Jürgen's farm.

view1: In a small Romani camp on the outskirts of Barcelona, Sofia lives with her grandmother, who expects her to continue their family's traditional craft of metalwork. However, Sofia has other plans and secretly attends art classes in the city, where she meets Raya, a free-spirited artist who encourages her to pursue her passion for painting. As they grow closer, Sofia must choose between following tradition or embracing her own desires, but their relationship is discovered by Sofia's grandmother, leading to a heart-wrenching confrontation that forces them to reevaluate their place in the community.
view2: In a small Romani village in Catalonia, Sofia lives with her grandmother, who expects her to follow in her footsteps and marry young. However, Sofia's life takes an unexpected turn when she meets Aisha, a free-spirited traveler from Morocco who is on a mission to learn about the Romani culture. Aisha introduces Sofia to the world of art and music, and they form a deep connection that goes beyond friendship. As their relationship blossoms, Sofia must confront her family's expectations and decide between tradition and her newfound love for Aisha.

view1: Major Perry Rhodan leads a three-woman mission to Mars on the rocketship Nova Spes, in search of a lost spaceship from the planet Xeridia. They find the ship and its crew, who are being held captive by an alien entity known as the 'Devourer'. The earthwomen soon discover that the Devourer is actually a creature from their own past, created to protect the planet from threats like the one they now face. The creature's technology holds the key to saving Earth from an impending disaster, and Rhodan must navigate its defenses to retrieve it. With the help of her crewmates, she manages to outwit the Devourer and escape Mars with the precious technology, but not before the creature reveals a shocking secret about their own planet's history.
view2: In a quest to find a source of advanced artificial intelligence, Major Perry Rhodan leads a four-man mission to Mars on the rocketship Stardust. On Mars, they discover a deserted research facility where Dr. Elara is trying to save a scientist named Astra from a deadly virus. The earthmen find that Astra is suffering from a rare disease for which there is an antidote available on Earth. Perry and others take a Martian shuttlecraft to Earth to bring back a team of scientists with the antidote. However, one of the Earth crewmen is a traitor, supplying information to a crime lord who seeks to capture Dr. Elara's research on advanced AI. The crime lord replaces the scientists with his own people and kidnaps Astra in a bid to gain access to Dr. Elara's technology. But Astra provides Rhodan and Bull with crucial information about the AI system, which helps them rescue Dr. Elara and the real scientists, who are able to cure Astra. They soon leave Mars in the Stardust, promising to return with materials the Martians need to repair their research facility.

view1: Former hitwoman Ji-hyun has reformed and is living a quiet life in the countryside. That is, until she's framed for the murder of a notorious crime lord. She escapes, takes a bullet, and finds herself in a small-town clinic. A young nurse, Min-soo, helps her evade capture. When Min-soo's younger brother goes missing, Ji-hyun teams up with him to track down their kidnappers, leading them on a perilous 48-hour adventure through the countryside.
view2: Former police officer Ji-hoon has reformed and is living a quiet life in the countryside. That is, until he's framed for the murder of a corrupt politician. He escapes from his pursuers, takes a bullet and ends up in a secluded cabin. A local nurse, Soo-young, helps him to escape and tend to his wounds. When Ji-hoon learns that Soo-young's young daughter has been kidnapped by the same people who framed him, he teams up with her to embark on a perilous 48-hour rescue mission.

view1: The film is set in a Tokyo skyscraper. Top-billed Al Pacino plays a maintenance worker, Tanaka, assigned to care for a foreign Prime Minister (Hiroyuki Sanada), who escaped an assassination attempt on the day he arrived in Japan for an official visit. With many threats against his well-being, the leader is heavily guarded around the clock. Tanaka manages to kidnap his patient for strictly personal gain, unaware that a hired sniper is still attempting to take the life of the foreign leader while in Tanaka's custody. This leads to a series of curious plot twists leading to a climactic scene with high-speed elevators on a rooftop helipad.
view2: The film is set in a Swiss ski resort. Top-billed Anthony Hopkins plays a seasoned ski instructor, Thompson, assigned to care for a wealthy businessman (Jean Reno), who escaped an avalanche on the day he arrived at the resort for a high-stakes business meeting. With many threats against his wealth, the tycoon is heavily guarded around the clock. Thompson manages to kidnap his client for strictly personal gain, unaware that a hired thief is still attempting to steal the businessman's valuable assets while in Thompson's custody. This leads to a series of curious plot twists leading to a climactic scene with a high-speed train on a treacherous mountain track.

view1: In the gritty metropolis of Red Rock, a former soldier, Axel, is out of rehabilitation after serving six years on a manslaughter charge. He returns to his old haunt, Ruby's Tavern, run by his estranged brother, Victor. New arrivals in town are the struggling artist: Lena, her free-spirited husband Kai and their toddler girl, Luna. In dire need of cash, Kai goes to work for a crime lord, Vinnie, but he isn't very skilled at his job. Axel, meanwhile, begins to develop a paternal and even romantic connection to Lena, who is hired by Victor to be a bartender. Kai runs afoul of the mafia boss in town, Marco Black, leading to a chaotic shootout at Marco's opulent estate.
view2: In the scorching desert city of Red Rock, a former soldier, Axel, is released from prison after serving ten years on a manslaughter charge. He returns to his old haunt, Maria's Tavern, run by his former comrade-in-arms, Maria. New arrivals in town are the struggling artist, Lena, her free-spirited boyfriend, Kael, and their young daughter, Aria. In dire need of cash, Kael takes a job with the ruthless mine owner, Victor, but he's not very skilled at his task. Axel starts to develop a paternal bond with Aria, who is hired by Maria as a waitress. Kael clashes with Victor, leading to a violent confrontation at Victor's heavily fortified mansion.

view1: Jae-ho is the owner of a small bookstore and volunteers at the local library, where his friend Min-ji works. The two run an illegal business together: Jae-ho occasionally steals rare books from the library's shelves with Min-ji, who deletes the library's catalog records that show the book was checked out. They sell the books on the black market. But when a young collector Soo-young comes back after having been searching for a rare edition, she discovers them and decides to go with them on a road trip to interview the book's potential buyers. Meanwhile, two collectors, Ji-hoon and Hyeon-ji, are on their trail.
view2: Ji-Hoon is the owner of a small antique shop and volunteers at the local museum, where his friend Min-Soo works. The two run an illegal business together: Ji-Hoon occasionally steals valuable artifacts from the museum's storage with Min-Soo, who deletes the museum's security footage that shows an artifact was taken. They sell the artifacts on the black market. But when a wealthy collector Soo-Young comes back after having bought one of their stolen items, she discovers them and decides to go with them on a road trip to interview the potential buyers. Meanwhile, two detectives, Hyeon-Seok and Ji-Hwan, are on their trail.

view1: The young and successful journalist, Emma Taylor, starts her novel with an epigraph: "This novel celebrates love, even though love may not celebrate itself." The title refers to the traditional Japanese tea ceremony that Emma participates in at a friend's wedding. As she watches the bride and groom exchange their vows, Emma realizes she never experienced a traditional high school prom because she was homeschooled. She decides to make up for it by masquerading as a student at a small-town high school. At the school, she quickly gains a reputation as a talented writer. Together with her classmates, she writes a school newspaper that critiques the school's administration. Her girlfriend, Olivia, tries to persuade her to give up her charade, but Emma falls in love with the school's principal and discloses her identity after provoking the teachers into expelling her from school.
view2: The novel starts with an epigraph: 'A life without music is like a bird without song.' The title refers to the famous piano sonata composed by a reclusive genius, Ludwig Schubert. While he performs his masterpiece at a charity gala, the struggling young musician, Emma Taylor, realizes she missed out on something because she was homeschooled and never attended a prestigious music academy. She decides to make up for it by masquerading as a student at a renowned conservatory. At the school, she quickly gains a reputation as a prodigy. Together with her classmates, she torments her professors, Herr Müller and Frau Klein, with musical pranks. Her boyfriend, Max, tries to persuade her to give up her charade, but Emma falls in love with the academy's director and discloses her identity after provoking the teachers into expelling her from school.

view1: The son of a humble baker, Pierre Dupont, is apprenticed to a local apothecary, Monsieur LaFleur. He soon replaces the shop's dog in turning the spit where meats roast. Under the tutelage of Father Adrien, a wise and kind Dominican friar, Pierre becomes proficient in Latin and mathematics. The two are hired by Madame de Ronsard, a renowned astronomer searching for evidence of lunar influences on human behavior in ancient texts.
view2: Léonard Ménétrier, a humble butcher, is the father of Jacques, who replaces their family's dog in turning the spit for roasting meats. Jacques catches the attention of Mr. Étienne Coignard, an eccentric abbot, who renames him 'the learned Jacobus Tournebroche' and teaches him ancient languages. They are hired by Mr. d'Astorg, a mysterious alchemist searching for mythical creatures in ancient texts. However, their research is disrupted by the erratic behavior of Mr. d'Anquetil, a rival scholar, and the vengeful pursuit of Jacques' uncle, who seeks to reclaim his family's lost fortune.

view1: In 1925, a young and ambitious Chinese engineer is swindled out of his life's savings by a wealthy American businessman. The engineer, seeking revenge, joins a group of rebels fighting against the Japanese occupation in Shanghai. He quickly rises through the ranks due to his technical expertise and becomes a key figure in planning a daring heist on a heavily guarded Japanese supply depot. However, during the raid, he is captured by the Japanese and sentenced to death. But just as the execution is about to take place, a mysterious amulet is discovered that suggests he is a direct descendant of the legendary Chinese general, Zhuge Liang. The Japanese, hoping to use him as leverage against the rebels, spare his life and offer him a deal: become their puppet leader in exchange for his freedom. But the engineer, fueled by anger and a desire for revenge, seizes an opportunity to turn the tables on his captors and leads a successful rebellion against the Japanese occupation.
view2: In 1925, a young and ambitious Chinese silk merchant is swindled by a wealthy Japanese textile tycoon in Shanghai. After being humiliated by the tycoon at a high-stakes mahjong game, he flees to the countryside. In 1930, he becomes a leader of the local resistance against the invading Japanese army, using his business skills to smuggle supplies and coordinate attacks. However, he is captured during a raid on a Japanese supply depot and sentenced to death by hanging. Just as the executioner's noose is about to be tightened around his neck, it is discovered that he is a direct descendant of the legendary Chinese general, Zhuge Liang. The Japanese commander, impressed by his ancestor's military genius, decides to spare his life and instead recruits him to lead a special task force against the communist rebels in the countryside. But as he becomes more powerful, the silk merchant turns against his former captors, using his newfound authority to orchestrate a series of daring raids against the Japanese occupation.

view1: Russia, 1922. The Bolsheviks hope to secure control of the vast oil fields around Grozny by launching a series of sabotage attacks on them. Viktor Petrov, a former Czarist officer who is working as a security expert, battles with the Red chief agent Comrade Kuznetsov and his associates.
view2: Russia, 1922. The Bolsheviks hope to secure control of the vast oil fields around Moscow by launching a series of sabotage attacks on them. Karl Müller, a German who is working as a engineer, battles with the Soviet chief agent Comrade Petrov and his associates. As tensions rise, Müller must use all his wits to uncover the true intentions of the Bolsheviks and protect the oil fields from destruction.

view1: In the year 2050, a team of Asian engineers and their military contingent embark on a mission to revive an ancient plan to create a massive inland 'Tibetan Lake' by diverting water from the Indian Ocean into the Tibetan Plateau. Led by Captain Kaida, they face resistance from the local Mongolian tribes who fear the new lake will disrupt their traditional grazing lands and way of life. As tensions escalate, the Mongolians launch a guerrilla campaign against the engineers, but Captain Kaida refuses to back down. However, their plans are foiled when a massive landslide triggers a catastrophic flood that inundates the plateau, drowning the insurgents and forcing the engineers to abandon their project.
view2: In the year 2050, a group of Asian engineers and their military team embark on a mission to revive an old plan to create a massive lake in the Gobi Desert by diverting water from the Yellow River. The project is led by Captain Lee, who faces opposition from the Mongolian tribes who fear that the new lake will disrupt their traditional way of life. As tensions rise, Captain Lee's team discovers a hidden underground city beneath the desert sands, inhabited by an ancient tribe who have been living in secret for centuries. However, before any resolution can be reached, a massive sandstorm hits the region, causing widespread destruction and flooding the Gobi Desert beyond anyone's expectations, ultimately sweeping away the Mongolian tribes' settlements.

view1: In 1955, Leo Marino is traveling rural Tuscany, offering to take screen tests of wannabe actors for a fee. He claims to work for big Milan film studios, but in reality he is a con artist. He meets several people who express their deepest feelings and secrets in front of the camera. At one of his stops he meets a young woman, Francesca, an opera singer who becomes attached to him despite his protestations. Leo and Francesca's relationship gradually evolves into a romantic one, when he's exposed as a con artist, beaten, and arrested. After serving his prison term, Leo comes back to seek Francesca, but finds her in a wealthy state, married to a rich businessman. Pretending to be Leo's friend, he conveys to her a message that she was the love of his life, and promises he shall come back with wealth and take care of her.
view2: In 1955, Luca Bianchi is traveling rural Tuscany, selling handmade leather goods to local villagers. He claims to work for high-end fashion houses in Florence, but in reality he is a struggling artist. He meets several people who express their deepest feelings and secrets as they try on his wares. At one of his stops he meets a young woman, Francesca, a widow who becomes attached to him despite his protestations. Luca and Francesca's relationship gradually evolves into a romantic one, when he's exposed as a con artist, beaten, and arrested. After serving his prison term, Luca comes back to seek Francesca, but finds her in a state of despair after losing her only child. Pretending to be a wealthy businessman, he conveys to her a message that she was the love of his life, and promises he shall come back with wealth and take care of her.

view1: In a Tokyo hostel, two young travelers engage in lovemaking after meeting at a karaoke bar. They exchange stories of their lives, with him confessing to leaving his family's business and her revealing that she's running away from an arranged marriage. As the night progresses, they grow closer, but she insists this will be her last fling before returning home.
view2: In a Tokyo hostel, two young travelers meet while waiting in line for the bathroom. They exchange glances and eventually start talking. He is Max and she is Yuna. As they walk around the city together, they share stories about their lives, including Max's struggles with anxiety and Yuna's fear of commitment. She confides that she has been engaged to a wealthy man but feels trapped in the relationship. Max reveals that he is running away from his past mistakes and doesn't know what the future holds. As the night progresses, they find themselves lost in conversation and eventually share a kiss under the Tokyo lights. Yuna insists that this will be her last adventure before settling down.

view1: Samantha 'Sam' Thompson, a free-spirited artist from New York, lives in Berlin and works as an assistant to a renowned photographer. She shares a loft with her straight-laced friend, Alex Chen, a financial analyst. Afraid of commitment, Sam prefers to focus on her art and has a casual relationship with her ex-boyfriend, Max, whom she doesn't love. Meanwhile, Alex is secretly pining for their neighbor, Jamie, but struggles to express his feelings due to his reserved nature. The arrival of Leo, a charming model and photographer's assistant, complicates matters as Sam finds herself drawn to him, while Alex must confront his own emotions and learn to take risks in love.
view2: Samantha 'Sam' Thompson, an Australian model, lives in Paris and works as a freelance photographer's assistant. She shares a small apartment with her straight-laced friend, Olivia Lee, a financial analyst. Afraid to be tied down, Sam prefers to focus on her career and sleep with her ex-boyfriend, Alex, whom she doesn't love. Olivia, who has been in a string of short-lived relationships, is hesitant to commit due to past heartbreaks. The arrival of Luca, a charming Italian chef at a local bistro, complicates things as they all navigate their feelings for each other and learn to let go of their fears.

view1: Ava (Riverview) is a 32-year-old artist who appears to have it all: a trendy studio, a loving partner, and a string of successful exhibitions. However, beneath her polished facade lies a deep sense of disconnection. She embarks on a journey to rediscover herself, accompanied by Julian (Kairos), a free-spirited photographer with a passion for capturing the beauty in decay. As they travel through the city's forgotten corners, Ava finds inspiration in the remnants of the past and begins to see her art – and herself – in a new light.
view2: Lena (Santos) is a 30-year-old successful event planner who appears to have it all: a beautiful apartment, a loving partner, and a thriving career. However, she feels suffocated by her high-society lifestyle and longs for something more authentic. When a local artist approaches her to plan an art festival in the city's historic district, Lena sees an opportunity to break free from her mundane routine. She embarks on a journey with Mateo (Garcia), a 32-year-old free-spirited photographer, to discover the city's hidden gems and uncover its rich cultural heritage. As they delve deeper into the city's history, Lena finds herself torn between her old life and the thrill of the unknown.

view1: After years of working as a skilled but underappreciated chef, Pierre Dupont has grown disillusioned with his life in Paris and moves to the small coastal town of Honfleur. He settles into a quiet routine, running a modest bistro and spending time with his wife, Sophie. However, when a young Roma girl named Zara arrives in town, fleeing her abusive family, Pierre's path crosses with hers. As he helps Zara evade the authorities, they form an unlikely bond, and Pierre finds himself rekindling his passion for cooking as he works to help Zara find a safe haven.
view2: Pierre, a former artist, has abandoned his dreams of becoming a painter and now works as a humble florist in the small town of Saint-Pierre. When his wife, Sophie, falls ill, Pierre's life is turned upside down. He meets an undocumented migrant from Eastern Europe who has just arrived in town. As the police begin to search for the young man, Pierre and his neighbors band together to help him evade capture. Meanwhile, a determined detective is hot on their trail, but it seems that everyone involved is hiding secrets of their own.

view1: In the unlikeliest of places, a group of women from different walks of life come together in the locker room of a local gym – each with their own unique struggles and triumphs. For one hour every day, they shed their inhibitions and share stories about love, loss, and everything in between. From the challenges of balancing work and family to the harsh realities of street harassment, these women bare it all, leaving viewers inspired by their strength and resilience.
view2: In 'Bus Stop Confessions', a group of strangers from different walks of life come together on a daily basis at a bustling bus stop in Manhattan, where they form an unlikely community. For 20 minutes every day, they stand side by side, waiting for their buses to arrive, and share stories about everything from love affairs to financial struggles, leaving behind their professional masks. A poignant look at the lives of working-class New Yorkers, 'Bus Stop Confessions' humanizes its subjects with unflinching honesty, revealing the complexities of life in urban America.

view1: Léa is freshly installed in Cergy-Pontoise, a trendy new town near Paris. She has a new apartment, a new job with no one over and no one under her. She meets Blanche at lunch one day, and soon she meets an acquaintance of Blanche, Gabriel, whom she approaches somewhat awkwardly. The film then follows the time-honored plot of exchange of relationships, as Léa and Blanche switch husbands.
view2: Blanche is freshly installed in Lyon, a vibrant new city near Geneva. She has a new apartment, a new job with no one over and no one under her. She meets Léa at dinner one evening, and soon she meets an acquaintance of Léa, Étienne, whom she approaches somewhat confidently. The film then follows the time-honored plot of exchange of relationships, as Blanche and Léa switch husbands.

view1: Sophie (Isabelle Huppert) is a woman whose love for her former lover will not die. The Writer Julien (Daniel Auteuil) left her, because she supported a conservative politician in his campaign. While her son Thomas (Guillaume Canet) falls in love with Emma (Léa Seydoux), Sophie keeps hoping that Julien will come back to her. Thomas helps her to fight for love and Sophie is so attached to this idea that when her daughter Charlotte (Lola Crnogorac) finally convinces her that he will never return, the realization has dire consequences.
view2: Sophie (Isabelle Huppert) is a woman whose love for her former lover will not die. The Doctor, Pierre (Gérard Depardieu), left her because she was involved in a few environmental protests. While her son, Thomas (Guillaume Canet), falls in love with a girl from the neighborhood, Sophie keeps hoping that Pierre will come back to her. Thomas helps her to fight for love and Sophie is so attached to this idea that when his sister finally convinces him that he will never return, the realization has dire consequences.

view1: After her parents' passing, Sofia returns to their estate in rural Tuscany, now managed by her uncle. She's initially charmed by the rolling hills and vineyards but soon grows restless. Her aunt, a boisterous and flirtatious woman, is more interested in gossiping with the local men than attending to Sofia's needs. The estate's caretaker, a gruff but kind-hearted man named Giovanni, seems like her only ally. However, as time passes, Sofia realizes that she's been idealizing life on the estate. She clashes with her aunt over the management of the vineyards and is disheartened by the lack of opportunities for women in the area. In desperation, she agrees to marry a wealthy but dull businessman who has been courting her aunt, hoping to escape the stifling atmosphere and secure a better future.
view2: After her mother's passing, Sofia returns to her family's estate in rural Poland, where she is greeted by her aunt's stern expression and the decaying grandeur of the mansion. As she settles into her new life, Sofia finds herself stifled by the monotony of country living and the oppressive atmosphere of the house. Her aunt, a strict disciplinarian, seems more interested in maintaining the family's reputation than in Sofia's well-being. The local priest, Father Kowalski, appears to be overly fond of Sofia, but his fawning behavior only makes her feel uncomfortable. In an attempt to escape the stifling routine, Sofia begins to explore the surrounding countryside, where she meets a group of traveling performers who introduce her to the world beyond the estate's walls.
